loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Lourdes is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2001, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es:
Elisabeth tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Elisabeth después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta de artesanía, ella sale a vender a la feria  que se organiza en la plaza principal de la ciudad del Pisaq, ella en su domicilio tiene un pequeño taller de fabricación de artesanía. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. Elisabeth requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambres y otras cosas más. 

Elisabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 26, has a child and lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.

Elizabeth sells crafts after doing her household chores.  She goes out to the market that takes place in Pisaq’s main square to sell her wares.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes the crafts.  She’s been in business for 15 years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  Elizabeth needs the loan to buy materials, like wire, and other things.  

Elizabeth belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy supplies, like wire, and many other things.

loans.name: Mujeres De Maíz Group

texts.es: Doña Reina V. V. D. G., es casada, tiene 45 años D. edad, tiene ocho hijos seis D. los cuales estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la artesanía, confección D. pants y playeras, su conyugue es comerciante, tienen ya dieciseis años con el trabajo que realizan, iniciaron con un capital pequeño que prestaron. Doña Reina decidió organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo y asi poder ampliar su capital D. trabajo, ya que cada una D. las integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como: confección D. pants, sudaderos, playeras, camisas, venta D. blusas, Baldes, cubetas y la crianza D. animales. Esperan ver mejor su negocio com mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Reina V. V. D. G. is 45 years old and married.  She has eight children, and six of them are in school.  She devotes herself to working with her hands.  She makes pants and t-shirts.  Her husband is a merchant.  They have been doing this work for 16 years.  They started with a small amount of borrowed money.

Reina decided to organize a group in order to request a loan.  That way they would be able to increase their working capital.  Each one of the members devotes themselves to different productive activities like making pants, sweatshirts, t-shirts, shirts, selling blouses, buckets, trays, and raising animals.  They hope to see their businesses improve with better earnings.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul A., 54, is the leader of this group. She and the other three members of the group are residents of a town called Toktogul. This town is a homeland for many talented Kyrgyz public people. This group of entrepreneurs also has a fair chance of making their hometown well-known for talents. 

Mairamkul is married and has three daughters. Her husband works in technical maintenance of the hydroelectric station “Kambar Ata.” 

For 21 years this couple has raised various types of cattle. The foundation was laid 21 years ago when Mairamkul’s husband spent his salary of 15,000 KGS on purchasing six head of cattle. 

Since then, for Mairamkul, cattle breeding has been the major activity, just like for anyone else in the neighborhood. At this moment, their monthly profit equals 5,000 KGS, most of which is spent on covering transportation and food costs. 

The purpose of Mairamkul’s loan is to buy more cattle for further breeding and reselling. Her future dreams are purchasing an automobile and land and boosting the number of cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support three children. Warlita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs.

Warlita has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future, Warlita would like to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repairs

loans.name: Jessie's Group

texts.en:
Jessie M. is from the village of Buenavista, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and is the leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default.

Jessie is married and has five adult-aged children. She has been a farmer for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month.

In March, 2005, Jessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers.

Jessie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm. This will be her eight loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the improvement of her house.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Narghush

texts.en:
Narghush S. was born in 1959 in Lusahovit village in the area of Ijevan. She got married and moved to Ijevan city when she was 18 years old. Now Narghush has 4 children: three daughters and a son. Two of her daughters are already married and live separately. Unfortunately a year ago Narghush's husband (who was Nor Horizon's client for a long time) died and now Narghush and her children continue their family’s business without him. 

Narghush and her family are running a bakery where they bake white and brown bread, whole meal bread and lavash (a flat bread). Narghush sells the bakery's produce on-site and she distributes bread at two food shops as well. Thanks to her business income, Narghush can solve her family's needs. 
Narghush is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to repair her bakery and to buy a new stove for lavash baking.

loans.use: to repair her bakery and buy new stove for lavash baking

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business of buying and selling vegetables and fruits. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Esther also does farming which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business and living a better life. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to resell and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 40 years old and has 6 children who are ages 5-22 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She sells malt (soaked sorghum) and she has done this business for many years.

From the profits she makes from this business, she can afford to pay her children’s school fees, medical insurance and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum for her to make more savings. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Maria Julia Del Rocio

texts.es:
María Julia D. 30 años, vive con su esposo e hija en casa D. sus padres, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Pimentel que se encuentra a unos minutos D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad pesquera, comercialización D. pescado y turístico.

María Julia se dedica a confeccionar y alquilar disfraces para todas la edades, también realiza prendas D. vestir a pedido, actividad que realiza desD. hace 3 años aproximadamente, negocio que lo a colocado en su casa y cuenta con su propia  clientela, al aumentar sus pedidos podrá tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar material para seguir confeccionando sus disfraces como ropa D. vestir, al aumentar sus ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos familiares.  María Julia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas D. superarse y D. sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María Julia is 30 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband and daughter. They receive water and electricity services. María Julia resides in the District of Pimentel, which is a few minutes away from Chiclayo Province. This developed area is known for its businesses related to catching and selling fish, as well as tourism.

María Julia produces and rents out costumes for all ages. She also makes everyday clothes upon request. María Julia has been in this business for approximately three years. She works out of her home and has her own customer base. An increase in orders has helped her achieve a better quality of life.

María Julia is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy material so that she can continue producing both costumes and clothing. The increased revenue will allow her to cover both her loan payments and her family expenses.

María Julia is an enterprising woman who desires to excel and help her family move forward.

loans.use: to purchase material for making costumes and clothing.

loans.name: Ayda María

texts.es:
Ayda María una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada quien desde hace diez años inicio su pequeño negocio que consistía en una pequeña y modesta venta de chiverías. Ella conforme el tiempo y los préstamos surtió su negocio con granos básicos, pan, huevo, productos lácteos…etc.
Ayda invertirá el crédito en arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, carne, gaseosa, chiverías…etc.
texts.en:
Ayda María is a hard-working woman, enterprising and industrious.  Ten years ago she started her small business which consists of a small and modest level of snack sales. She pays on time and the loans have supplied her business with basic grains, bread, eggs, dairy...etc.

Ayda will invest the loan in rice, sugar, oil, beans, meat, soda, snacks...etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, meat, soda, snacks...etc.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is hard working and a born-again Christian. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with three children aged 10, 7 and 3. He has been running a cafeteria since 2007. He supplements his income from the salary he gets from his employment as a night guard. He wants, in the next five years, to be a successful businessman. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sack of beans, baking flour, cooking fat and baking powder.

loans.use: To buy a sack of beans, baking flour, cooking fat and baking powder

loans.name: Raquel Evangelina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a La señora Raquel. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija la misma que ya es mayor de edad y casada pero aun viven con ella, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja en el mercado de la ciudad. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 6 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda  en su negocio y además porque los créditos son muy fáciles de realizar.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas donde muestra su mercadería, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan pedidos ya que los productos que ella vende son de muy buena calidad. Trabaja todos los días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la traen de  Guayaquil, lleva con su negocio 10 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien. En la actualidad quiere empezar con la venta de calzado.

Este crédito es para comprar la  pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y zapatos ya que espera entrar en este negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción y que le vaya bien en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Rocafuerte Communal Bank meet in the Rocafuerte canton. This area is known for its delicious sweets, prepared by the locals, which are known throughout the country.

Here we meet Mrs. Raquel. She is 56, married and has one daughter from this union. Her daughter is now grown and married, but she and her husband and their two children still live with Raquel. Her husband works in the city market. Raquel has been a member of the Communal Bank for 6 years and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her business, and because the loans are very easy to access.

She sells clothing of all types. She sells door-to-door and also sells from her home, where she has display cases to display her merchandise. She tells us that her customers make orders from her, since the products that she sells are of very good quality. She works every night, and all day on weekends. She lets her customers buy on credit and charges every fifteen days. She has her merchandise delivered from Guayaquil. She has had this business for 10 years and it has always gone well for her. She now wants to start selling shoes.

This loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing and shoes, since she hopes to enter into shoe sales.

Her dreams are to finish her house, since it is under construction, and for her businesses to go well.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Arellys

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Arellys se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Jefe de despacho en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace tres años. Es soltera y con una personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen a un nivel de vida mejor.

La señora Arellys ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de vida, este credito lo va a invertir  en pago de posgrado para preparacion profesional de ella.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Arellys works very hard as an office manager in a state institution.  She has been doing this work for 3 years.  She is single and has one dependent to whom she must provide the conditions needed so that they can develop and have a better life.

Arellys has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan so that she can raise her standard of living.  She will invest this loan in paying for graduate studies for her professional development.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
La señora Elena, tiene 44 años D. edad, nació en la provincia D. Anta del distrito D. Cachimayo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad D. Chuso distrito D. Chinchero D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la comunidad y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Elena está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos pues ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, ovejas, cuyes, gallinas y para tierras D. cultivo comprara abono, fertilizantes y semillas.   

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Natividad D. Chuso” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Chuso en la casa D. unas D. las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. Chuso y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. comida, crianza D. animales menores, venta D.  granos, venta D. tubérculos, venta D. carne, elaboración D. artesanía. La comunidad D. Chuso se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos en carro D. la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desD. hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica D. América".
texts.en:
Mrs Elena is 44 years old, was born in the Cachimayo district, in the province of Anta (Cusco) and now lives in Chuso, in the Chincherro district, in the province of Urubamba, Cusco. She has been living and doing business here for several years.

Elena is married and has 5 children. She works hard in agriculture and livestock to raise her children. She has been working in this business for several years and is doing well thanks to her hard work. Elena now needs a loan to buy minor species such as pigs, sheep and chicken as well as fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

The meetings of the communal bank “Virgen D. Natividad D. Chuso” take place every 30 days in Chuso in a member's house. The communal bank is maD. up of hardworking and enterprising people who are on the constant look-out for oppoortunities to get ahead. By working hard every day, they aim to give their children a better future. Most members live in Chusco and work in businesses such as selling food, minor species husbandry, selling grain, root vegetables and meat and crafts. Chuso is located an hour and twenty minutes drive from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the ""Archaeological Capital of America".

loans.use: to buy minor species such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, chickens and to buy fertilizers and seeds for farmland.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transport services to the passengers. He is very much an expert in driving and people trust his safe driving. Kosar herself is a very caring lady. She spends most of her time at home taking care of her family and doing household works. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw because the engine is creating problems. Kosar is hopeful that a fully repaired rickshaw will enable her husband to continue providing his transport services to the passengers and earning more income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: For the last year, Theresa has walked around the village of Jukwa selling eggs, tiger-nuts and groundnuts from a basket perched on top of her head.  Theresa’s dream is to expand her business. The loan will help her to continue buying groundnut, tiger-nut and other products to sell. The profits are used to pay for food and to maintain her home.

loans.use: to continue buying groundnut, tiger-nut and others to sell.

loans.name: Jessibel

texts.en:
Jessibel is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Jessibel has a shop that buys and sells firewood. She has had this business for five years. 

Jessibel is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy firewood to sell.  Jessibel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Janneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Janneth es socia del banco comunal Ensueños, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, es considerada  patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador. Su gente es amable, gentil, cálida y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía.

La Señora. Janneth tiene 27 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 5 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es  propiedad de sus padres y como vive con ellos comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella tiene una boutique  hace 7 años, en la cual trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7  de la noche.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa como: blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños, pantalones, etc. para surtir su local.
 
Su meta es agrandar mucho más su boutique.
texts.en:
Janneth is a member of the "Ensueños" communal bank, and lives in the central part of the city of Azogues. This city is the capital of Cañar province, and is considered part of the architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people are friendly, kind, and warm. They maintain their culture and traditions, and have a varied cuisine,

Janneth is 27, divorced, and has a five year-old son who goes to a small school in the city. The house where she lives belongs to her parents, and as she lives with them, she shares the household costs. 
 
She has had a boutique for seven years, where she works Mondays through Saturdays, from 9:00am to 7:00pm.  

She has been in the communal bank for a year and a half, and she will use her new loan to buy clothing such as, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, pants etc. to stock her shop. Her goal is to greatly expand her boutique.

loans.use: To buy blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tarps and other necessary tools to provide better customer srvice.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 43 years old and married. He has been running a greengrocery in Malindi for the last 14 years with a monthly profit of about KES 15,000.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 19,500 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to sell.

He will save the anticipated profit to provide the basic needs for his family. In future he hopes to grow his business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es: Tesalia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y deseosa de progresar. Vive en compañía de su esposo William y su hijo de 15 años de edad en su casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Tesalia es la costura, oficio que aprendió ayudando a una amiga en su taller, con los ingresos logró comprar su propia maquina de coser, iniciándose de esta manera en este oficio. Desde hace nueve años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado hacerse conocida y gracias a ello, creció su negocio, contando ahora con la ayuda de una amiga a la que paga por trabajo o pedido entregado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual ayuda con los gastos del hogar a su esposo. El estar ocupada y sentirse una mujer productiva es lo que más le gusta, por ello desea ampliar su negocio e instalar más maquinas y poder abrir un taller grande, desde donde podría atender a sus clientes, sabiendo que esto le generaría mejores ingresos económicos, así  como el poder dar empleos a otras personas. Este sería el crédito número ocho con la institución MFP, le gusta su trabajo de su banco comunal, se siente cómoda y a gusto. Espera seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, por lo que será puntual en el pago de su cuota. Con el monto prestado, lo invertirá en materiales de costura, como telas e hilos en mayor cantidad y a menores precios, logrando así mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tesalia, 44, is a hard-working, enterprising, and happy woman who wants to make progress.  She lives with her husband William and her 15-year-old son in her house, which is her own property.

Tesalia's job is sewing, a trade she learned helping a friend in her workshop.  With her income Tesalia managed to buy her own sewing machine, in this way starting in the trade.  For nine years she has managed to make herself known, thanks to which her business grew.  Now she has the help of a friend whom she pays by job or order completed.

What Tesalia likes about her job is being able to have an income with which she can help her husband with the household expenses.  Being busy and feeling like a productive woman is what she likes most.  This is why she wants to expand her business and install more machines and be able to open a big workshop from where she can take care of her customers.  She knows that this will generate more income for her and that she will be able to give jobs to other people.

This would be her eighth loan with the MFP institution.  She likes the work of her communal bank.  She feels comfortable and at home.  She hopes to continue getting the institution's support, for which she will be punctual with her payments.

With the loan Tesalia will buy sewing materials such as fabric and thread wholesale and at lower prices, getting better profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 57-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines. She raises pigs for a living, fattening them to sell at the market. Martina is able to support her family in this way.

Martina plans to use her loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase piglets and feed. This loan will help Martina achieve her goals: to send her children to college and expand her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Doña Gertrudis, sigue en el comercio en venta de ropa y bisituria, el cual junto a su esposo, siguen esforzandose para una vivienda mejor, sus hijos estudiando. 
Gertrudis, con este nuevo financiamiento hara cambio de techo, comprara laminas de zinc, y perlines para reforzar mas el techo, el cual ira por parte con esta mejora, ya que los materiales esta ah altos costos, y su capacidad de pago es poca, es por tal razon ira por parte, hasta lograr el objetivo de una mejor vivienda, en donde no se le pase el agua en tiempo de invierno.
texts.en: Doña Gertrudis continues selling clothes and costume jewelry. Together with her husband, she continues to work hard for a better home and education for their children. With this new loan, Gertrudis will change the roof, buying zinc sheets and metal purlins to further reinforce the roof, which will go part way to making the improvements as building materials cost a lot and her ability to pay is small. This is the reason why she will make only part of the improvements until achieving her goal of an improved home without leaks for the winter.

loans.use: to change the roof and improve her home.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario lives with his family in the town of Alicia, Isabela. He is 55 years old and a father of five adult children. Apolinario is engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily for breeding. He has been in this business for 18 years. Through the income he generates from his business he has been able to  provide food for his family's needs and also support the extended family. 

At this time, Apolinario is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. Apolinario wishes to have a higher income from the business so he will have his own savings. He says he is getting older and that's why he wants to build his savings in preparation for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie lives at Roma Norte, Enrile with her four children. Unluckily, she was separated from her spouse due to some personal problems. Margie carries the burden alone in sustaining the needs of her children, especially for a good education. She is currently sending them to high school. 

Margie raises crops from her one hectare rice field. She pays for additional laborers to help her do farming activities. She also raises hogs to add to her income. As of now, she would like to increase her earnings and is in need for additional capital so she is now requesting for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy three bags of rice seeds and six bags of UREA (fertilizer) for use in farming.

In the future, though it is difficult to be engaged in this kind of business, Margie wants to keep growing as an successful entrepreneur to make her family live more fortunately.

loans.use: To buy three bags of rice seeds and six bags UREA (fertilizer) for use in farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old and has been operating a small retail shop for the last year, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd.  He plans to use the loan to buy additional stocks of cooking flour, cooking oil, washing soap and other household commodities.  John will save the anticipated profit with the intention of growing his business as well as looking after himself.

In the future, John hopes to grow his business into a wholesale store and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María es casada con el señor Agustín, tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 años y otro de 10 años  que se encuentran en edad escolar, la señora vive en alquiler mas de 5 años en el mismo lugar. La señora María se dedica a la venta de comida ambulando por lugares concurridos, ella vende todos los días de la semana tomándose así un día de descanso para estar con su familia. El préstamo es para invertir en otro negocio, comercio de arroz y venta de arroz, debidos a que ella asegura que puede tener un mejor ingreso ya que esto llevara a distintas provincias, siempre alternando con su primera actividad que es la venta de comida, la Sra. María es una persona muy amable y trabajadora se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: María is married to Agustín and they have two children, ages six and ten, who are in school.  For over five years they have lived in the same rental property.  María is a street vendor and sells food in busy areas.  She works six days a week and takes a day off to be with family.  The loan she is requesting is to invest in another business, rice trade and sales.  She claims she can earn a better income this way since it will mean traveling to other provinces, although she will alternate this activity with her main food business.  María is a very kind, hard-working person who is content with the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy bulk rice.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
She is married and has nine children living in a five room’s house at Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.she hates thinking about the drowning of her son in a river . She is very confident that the business will be successful because she has grasp perfect knowledge about her petit trading business, booming sales during Christmas and the strategic location of the business.
      The loan from will be used to buy seedlings like  corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams,fertilizers,feed,chemicals and rent a piece of land for cultivation.
 The community will benefit by buying dresses, shoes and raw food item after harvest at cheaper prices.
             With the profit from the business, she will be able to expand her business, educate her children in school, look after her health situation, and also cater for the needs of the family. She prefers a loan from Ghape because it has low interest rates and a new loan can be given as soon as you finish the old one, also couple with the fact that GHAPE offers non financial services that is training and social networking

loans.use: To buy beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams seeds,fertilizers,feed,chemicals and rent a piece of land for cultivation.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of six and from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya.

She has spent the past ten years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Evaline is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart.

Evaline wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell.

The Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Evaline will be able to sell cereal at the local market and to her neighbours. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Evaline is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from selling cereal will go to pay her school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. She knows that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders, her dreams will become reality. Evaline awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as humble.

She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as low stock.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 48 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Judith is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Judith started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2012, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Judith’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hijo y su nieto, el se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de bueyes desde hace 15 años e inicio con ese trabajo por la necesidad de tener mas ingresos economicos y es gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de un buey para seguir con la crianza y asi poder seguir con su trabajo.

loans.use: compra de un buey

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en:
Ayna is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 42. She married and has 2 children. She lost her husband in war and she is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $200 from Normicro in 2002 she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $500 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.

She applies for the loan $800 to repair shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and to repair shop

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
2 years ago Alik decided to start this business.
Having borrowed $400 he bought 4 sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 8 sheep.  
Alik is 34 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
Alik is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
J. Juma has been engaged in fabric sales for 5 years. After leaving the secondary school, he could not continue the education. He is married and has five children. He recently married off his elder son. Furthermore, as it should be, he had to provide him a separate apartment. In order to give his children good education – he is trying to create conditions for study.

Having begun his business, he mainly looked to his wife for advice – she is more experienced in fineness of fabric quality and demand – however, in present time, he succeeds in the financial part of his business, and also in market needs.

To increase his income level, he undertakes such actions as purchasing more large consignments from main wholesale providers, though he has not been able to do this before – and he needs a greater assortment. The loan provides opportunities for these actions.

loans.use: Increase of good assortment

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Ever since 6 years ago Maria started her own business selling clothing, footwear and ceramics. She opened her own business because of the financial need her family was going through. She is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 27.

Her husband is employed in a local business, nonetheless, his wage is insufficient to pay for all of the house's expenses and the education of their children.

Little by little Maria has made her business grow since she enjoys sales and has a great desire to move on ahead.

Nowadays, her clients have multiplied as have her sales. Maria is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase merchandise and offer a greater variety of products and better service to her clientèle.

She is committing to pay back this amount in 6 months. Maria thanks the opportunity you provide her family with your support to grow her business and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Desde hace seis años Maria emprendió su negocio con la venta de ropa, calzado y cerámica. Inició debido a la necesidad por la que pasaba su familia, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos entre 21 y 27 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como empleado de una empresa de la localidad, sin embargo, su salario era insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, poco a poco Maria a hecho crecer su negocio gracias a su gusto por las ventas y a su deseo de salir adelante.

Ahora sus clientes se han multiplicado al igual que sus ventas y Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares para compra de mercancía y poder ofrecerle una mayor variedad y un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.en: Luz is a 33-year-old mother with a beautiful 7-year-old daughter and a second child due to arrive in a few months. Her husband works as a programming coordinator for a television station in Santo Domingo.  Luz buys silver jewelry wholesale and sells it to customers in her community.  She also sells makeup accessories.  She has come to us for a loan of $350 to acquire new inventory to sell, and to introduce gold-plated jewelry to her product line.  She’ll repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell and introduce gold jewelry to her product line

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is 43 years old and is the mother of two boys. Her husband works with dustcarts picking up rubbish.

Altagracia dedicates herself to the sale of women’s underwear. She has been doing this kind of business for more than ten years. She has a well-established clientele; many of them live in other provinces. She gets the goods from Elías Piña, a city on the border of Haiti. Sometimes she buys the products in Haiti.

This entrepreneur wants to enlarge her business. She has applied for a loan to acquire large amounts of underwear so she can noticeably augment her sales volume and increase profits. Extra money will help Altagracia better provide education and food for her two sons.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy large quantities of underwear so that  the entrepreneur can increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Mekala

texts.en:
Mekala V. is forty years of age, from the village of Faleula. She has three young kids and they are attending primary school. Mekala‘s husband does not have a job and there in no regular income for her and the family.

When she heard about SBPD loans, she joined one of the centers at the village and tried to find out if she is qualifed. She is on her first loan now and she is using all of it on starting up the business. Mekala already has a big plantation and she is now turning it into a business. She is also running a vegetable garden business, and her dream is to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, chemicals and fertilizers for the plantation

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
S. Nodira is 29 years old. She is married. Her husband is unemployed, but he is helping his wife. Nodira does not have yet the kids. However, she and her husband are supporting Nodira’s mother-in-law and sister-in-law.

Nodira is selling foodstuffs like macaroni, noodles, rice, oil, etc. in one of the local markets. Having been in this business for several years, Nodira knows how to run it properly. The business is stable and generates the significant income for the family.

Nodira has been a client of IMON for 7 years already. She is an accurate client having the positive history without any delinquency or violations. Today Nodira requests 1000.00 US Dollars for purchasing the foodstuff in order to enlarge the range of goods she is able to sell. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of the goods to increase product selection

loans.name: Almahmad

texts.ru:
Almahmad Subonkulovich M. lives in Yavan. He is 46 years old and married with six children. Almahmad has a specialized high school education in accounting. For a living he raises animals, and would like a loan in order to buy calves to fatten and sell. He has 15 years of experience in this business, and it is the only source of income for his family. In addition, the development of private livestock breeding contributes to the development of the entire livestock sector and helps maintain meat prices. Almahmad plans to repay his loan within three months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Менгликулов алмахмад субонкулович житель города Яван. 46лет ,женат ,имеет 6 детей. Образование средне- специальное.По специальности бухгалтер. Занимается животноводством. Кредит запрашивает для того.чтобы купить бычков для откормки и последующей их реализации. Опыт работы в этой сфере 15 лет.Этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Так же развитие животноводства в частном порядке дает возможность развитию всего сектора, что позволяет сохранять цены на мясо.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn is 34 years old and has two children in school. Her husband is a successful general contractor. Mrs. Nguyễn tends T. their rice paddies, raises pigs, and makes rice paper wrappers for an income. She is also involved with her community after she was elected as a leader for their women. Mrs. Nguyễn wants T. loan $130 from Kiva for a term of twenty-five weeks T. purchase more feed for her pigs. Other members of her loan group want T. expand their current businesses. One member of the group with the same last name, Mrs. Nguyễn, raises chickens. Mrs. Trần, yet another Mrs. Nguyễn, and Mrs. Tô, all have businesses related T. pigs. Mrs. Đỗ has a fruit business. | Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuâm 34 tuổi, có hai con còn đang đi học. Chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Chị là chi trưởng phụ nữ thôn, tuy là cán bộ nhưng chị rất đảm đang trong công việc gia đình. Chị làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn và làm bánh đa nem. Tham gia chuwong trình tà chính vi mô binhminh với mức vốn 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần, chị dùng để bổ sung vốn mua cám cho lợn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: 
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 2006000 để chăn nuôi gà. Chị Trần Thị Tình vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Đỗ Thị Hồng vay 2006000 đồng để buôn bán hoa quả. Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu vay 2006000 đồng để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Tô Thị Hà vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ và mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Animal farming & vending | chăn nuôi, buôn bán

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Abdurasul Toshimirov lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 4 children. He has a professional degree as an engineer. Since Abdurasul is currently cannot find work as an engineer, he has been earning his living as a salesman. He rents a stall at the local market where he sells spare parts. Abdurasul has been maintaining his business for the last three years. His business is the sole source of income for his family and it also supports the local community by providing them with spare parts without the need to travel outside of their region. Abdurasul is currently planning to increase his inventory and the variety of goods he offers for sale. This will allow him to better supply the market and will increase his profits. To finance this expansion Abdurasul has turned to us for a loan. He is planning to take out a loan of 1025 US dollars and pay pack the money in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Тошмиров Абдурасул житель города Турсун-заде. Женат , имеет 4 детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. По специальности инженер. Но так как у Абдурасула нет постоянного места работы , он занимается бизнесом. На рынке города имеет торговую точку , на которой торгует запчастями .Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Его бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того он помогает населению , обеспечивая их необходимым товаром. При этом им не приходится выезжать за покупками за приделы их местности. Клиент на данный момент хочет увеличить товарооборот и ассортимент товара. Этим он сможет увеличить предложение на рынке , а так же увеличить собственный доход. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Планирует получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США, а погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en: Kahramon J.  is 43 years old and  is married with 6 children. Kahramon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.  Kahramon has been engaged in the livestock business for 6 years but he had learned  good and special skills as a child from his father. Mr. Kahramon J.  is a very good family man. He has a pedigree bull and a milk cow. Mr. J. Kahramon is engaged raisin and selling livestock. This is a part time business as his full time job is as a  professional accountant  for the collective farm. Mr. J. Kahramon has a good reputation and applies to KIVA for a  business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase rams and develop his sheep business.He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to  small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase rams and develop his sheep business.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Serafina's first loan

Serafina is a member of the Village Bank Prosperity. She is married, 63 years old and has seven children. Serafina sells various foods typical of the region at a stand in the Santa Clara market every day. Furthermore, Serafina rents a mototaxi which her children use to proviD. public transportation around the city of Ayacucho.

Serafina needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), money which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, potatoes, oil and noodles.

Serafina's dreams are to better her business and her house, and that her children have stable jobs.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, potatoes, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Click this link to view Maxima's first loan.

Maxima is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is married and has two children.

Maxima sells cheese and cereal on the streets of the Nery Garcia Market. Also, Maxima sells garlic, from the city of Chuschi, that she hand peels. Furthermore, Maxima raises and sells guinea pigs - a traditional Peruvian protein source - to restaurants and in outdoor areas, a business that is slowly increasing.

Maxima needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US375) to invest in alfalfa seeds that she will cultivate in order to feed her guinea pigs.

Maxima's dreams are to have more storehouses and a stable, to further extend her business and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To invest in alfalfa seeds that she will cultivate in order to feed her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sayli

texts.ru:
Saili P. resides in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is trained as a nurse and works in the local policlinic. In her free time she works in agriculture. Her husband and children help her. She has collected her first harvest. For another harvest, she would like to purchase quality seeds and mineral fertilizers. Therefore she would like to obtain a loan for the period of 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Пирова Сайли жительница района А.Джоми. Возраст 40 лет, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-техническое, по специальности медицинская сестра. Она работает мед.сестрой в местной поликлинике. В свободное от работы время клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством. Помогаютей ее муж и дети. В данный момент она собрала первый урожай. На повторный посев она хочет закупить качественные семена и минеральные удобрения. На что она решила взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady Y. est née le 02/01/74 dans le département de Bambey,elle réside à keur Djimith mais mène son commerce de fruits et légumes au marché cental de Bambey.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contirbuer aux dépenses familiales et surtout l'entretien de ses enfants.elle a deux (02) ans d'expérience dans son activité.
texts.en:
Khady Y. was born January 2, 1974 in the Bambey region. She lives in Keur Djimith but runs her fruits and vegetables business at the main market in Bambey. The income generated by her business allows her to contribute to family expenses and especially to take care of her children. She has two years of experience working in this business.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales

loans.name: Mrs. Mot Sreang's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty members, is located in Trapeang Krasang Village in Kampong the Cham Province. Mrs. Mot S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Mrs. Mot S. is 42 years old and is the mother of two children one of whom works in a garment factoR. while the youngest attends the local school. She owns a lake where she raises fish for a living. Mrs. Mot S.'s fish have maN. babies but she does not have enough money to buy more food for them. Thus, she has decided to make a request for a loan so that she can purchase more fish food. Her husband, Mr. Ly Vannchroy, is a construction worker and a cow breeder.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more food to feed her fish.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en: Rohat is a mother of 2 wonderful kids. For several years she has sewn bed sheets and pillowslips. Her son, who sells women's clothing at the market, sells his mom's sewing. Her husband works as a driver and doesn't make much money, so her business is very helpful to support their family. She wants to take a loan for expanding her business and pay for her son's wedding someday.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y su única hija. Desde joven conoció la agricultura como una actividad muy rentable, cuando se casó sembró en grandes cantidades, las ganancias le dieron la oportunidad de comprar un vehículo, ahora, con su carro realiza taxi, sin dejar de cultivar de modo alternado. Con el taxi gana diariamente S/.40.00, las dificultades se presentan cuando el carro se malogra y tiene que hacer cambiar las piezas, las cuales son muy caras. Pero en general, está muy contento con la actividad que realiza. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado tiene previsto cambiar las llantas de su auto, y también comprará abono para su chacra de cítricos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a 43-year-old married man who lives with his wife and only daughter. Ever since he was young, he realized that agriculture is a very lucrative line of work. When he got married, he planted a great amount of crops. The profits obtained from his crops gave him the opportunity to purchase a car, with which he now offers taxi services, while still cultivating on the side. He makes 40.00 PEN with his taxi cab, but he faces difficulties when his car breaks down and he has to purchase parts, which are very expensive. In general, he is very happy with this business. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money being requested, he plans on replacing his car tires and purchasing fertilizer for his citrus farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his taxi cab

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida I. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She has managed to send four to junior high school, but the rest have dropped out of school because of financial constraints. Currently she lives in Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region. But her original home town is Bawku in the northern part of Ghana. She came to settle in Atebubu about thirty years ago when she was forced to marry a man she was not interested in during her childhood. She ran away from home, and since then she has not returned to her home town. Rashida is a food vendor and has sold rice with stew in the marketplace of Atebubu for fifteen years. She wants the loan to buy supplies like bags of rice, spices, charcoal, and meat, so that her business proceeds can be used to pay her children's education fees. She believes your help can transform her life. She is member of the group called ‘Ima’ meaning Amen Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Managing a village store has become a daily routine for Rowena.  The business is doing well and is being managed well; however, there are still many things Rowena and her husband would like to do to further improve their business.  

Rowena is now requesting a loan of PHP 5000 (125 USD) which will greatly aid in the improvement of her business, allowing her to purchase additional inventory and merchandise. The store renovations will be set aside for the future. She wants to invest her money in her store and then save for the future needs of their family.  

Rowena I. is 23 years old and married to Rommel, her business partner.  The couple has a two-year-old daughter named Trisha Mae and they are living in Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela with their parents and some relatives.  Rowena is happy that, despite being a young couple, they are able to handle their responsibilities well as being parents to Trisha.

loans.use: Purchase inventory.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 30 años y desde muy joven siempre se esforzó por mejorar su vida, vive en su casa propia, con su esposo Francisco de 32 y su hijo Ubaldo de 6 años, ella trabaja sin descanso para alcanzar las metas que se ha trazado. En su pequeña casa hecha de adobe, Dionisia lleva 2 años trabajando sin descanso, tejiendo unos pequeños y graciosos muñequitos de lana, los cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puno, donde son los turistas los que más se entusiasman con sus muñequitos y los compran muy rápidamente. Dionisia se divierte mucho haciendo estos graciosos muñequitos, lo cual la llena de satisfacción, ya que sabe que también de esa manera puede darle de comer a su familia, espera que con el tiempo pueda poner un negocio más estable que le brinde unos buenos ingresos económicos, puesto que sabe que tiene que darle unos buenos estudios a su querido hijo, el cual corresponde su sacrificio con mucho amor y siempre la acompaña a todos lados. Son cuatro ya los préstamos que Dionisia ha solicitado en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Dionisia quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual invertirá todo el dinero en comprar más lana, para aumentar la cantidad de muñequitos que teje.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 30 years old, and since she was very young she has always pushed herself to improve her life. She lives in her own house with her husband Francisco, 32, and her son Ubaldo, 6 years old. She works without rest to reach the goals that she has drawn up. In her small house made of adobe, she has worked for 2 years without rest, weaving small and amusing dolls made from wool. She takes these dolls to sell in the city of Puno, where there are tourists that become excited about her dolls and buy them rapidly. Dionisia really enjoys making these amusing dolls, which fills her with satisfaction, and she now knows that through these means she can provide food for her family. She hopes in time to create a more stable business which will give her economic earnings, and she knows she has to provide good studies for her dear son, who responds to her sacrifices with a lot of love and always accompanies her everywhere she goes. Dionisia has requested 4 loans through MFP, and she has been very punctual with her repayments. She has never had problems with her communal bank, where she charged with providing the happiness quota that keeps the rest of her members very happy. Dionisia wishes to increase her working capital, and will invest all of it in buying more wool, to increase the amount of little dolls that she weaves.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for her weavings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is 36 years old and a married woman with four children. Currently all her kids are in school. Florence lives with her nuclear family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband is a security man in a certain company in her community. 

Florence has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc. in the local market of Dorma for three years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, and pork to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. With your support she feels it would bring lots of transformation to her business. Florence belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She also hope to receive GHS 550 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Senaida Anassely

texts.es:
La señora Senaida Anassely C. López tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cruz de Pargo, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, abandono los estudios debido a que no le gustaba el colegio y se dedico a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. Tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 
Senaida se dedica a la compra-venta de animales desde hace 2 años junto con su esposo, en tiempos de cosecha a la compra-venta de cereales y papa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de un huacho.
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de huachos. 
Senaida sueña con tener muchos animales para criar y vender, así como tener su casa propia.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Senaida Anassely C. López is 20 years old and lives in the settlement of Cruz de Pargo, Salpo district, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through primary school and abandoned her studies due to the fact that she did not like high school and she started working helping her mother with the chores in the home. She has two small children who are dependent on her. For the past two years Senaida and her husband have worked buying and selling animals. During harvest time she buys and sells cereal and potatoes. She is developing a business in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles from her community bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) was used to buy an orphaned animal. This loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy more orphaned animals. Senaida dreams of having many animals to raise and sell, and also of having her own home. She belongs to the Vaso de Leche of her region (is provided with food assistance).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa P., 17, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public three days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Temukisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy chicken thighs, sausages, sauce, onions, foam plates, forks and spoons, tissues.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, del distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Posee estudios primarios, ella vive en la comunidad de Casana.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de carne.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de carne y la venderá al por mayor para poder incrementar sus utilidades y generar mas ingresos en su hogar.
Ella  nos comenta que se siente un poco delicada de salud, pero esta muy feliz de pertenecer a su Banco Comunal ya que le gusta la forma de su manejo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Dios es Amor" community bank, which is located in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the suburb of Puno. María is 53 years old and lives with her partner and three children in Casana. She completed her formal education through elementary school. María has worked with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she used to purchase meat. With the current loan of 1000 soles, María plans to purchase more meat, which she will sell wholesale thereby earning a living for her family. María has some minor health problems, but is very glad to be a part of the community bank and thinks it is well-run.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Meat

loans.name: Brígida Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyu” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida Jr. Zepita S/n.  Solo tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de productos de la región (papas, chuño, ocas)y frutas.
Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, comprará variedades de productos de la región como papa, chuño, tunta, ocas y habas, para luego venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y así juntar un buen capital.
 
A la señora Brígida refiere que le gusta mucho las reuniones y la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Brígida is a member of the Yunga Uyu Communal Bank in the District of Yunguyo, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 47 years of age, in a civil marriage and has six children. She lives on Zepita Avenue in the Alto Florida neighborhood. She has only an elementary (third grade) education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last two years. Her work is buying and selling local produce, such as potatoes, chuño and ocas (Andean tuberous root crops), and fruit. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols. With this loan of 900 New Sols, she will buy various local produce such as potatoes, chuño, tunta ("white chuño"), ocas and beans which she will later sell in the 15 de Agosto market. She wishes to improve her business in order to increase her earnings and thus build up her capital. Señora Brígida relates that she likes very much the Manuela Ramos meetings and the way that they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local produce to sell in the market.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон Эргашев проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить скотину для откорма и продажи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. В этом ему помогают его дети.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon E. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 35 years old, is married and has 4 children. The client is asking for a loan to purchase livestock to fatten and sell. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. His children help him.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. is married and has one child. She has studied to a junior high school level. Rose sells polyester, zips and works as a seamstress at the same time at Ahado in Hohoe. Her husband is a teacher with the Ghana Education Service and is a low income earner. Rose uses her income to support her husband in covering the utility bills and other housekeeping expenses. Rose will use the loan to purchase a good sewing machine to increase her productivity. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thomas S.'s Group

texts.en:
The members of this loan group, secondary school teachers in Makeni City, are requesting a loan in order to supplement their monthly salaries. With the help of a loan, they will be able to invest in business, pay their children’s school fees, or buy something needed. Their school bursar will deduct each teacher’s repayment amount from their monthly salaries and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Thomas S. C. (first on the right in the photo) is the leader of this group. Thirty-five years old and married with one child who is in class one, Thomas was born in Makali in the Tonkolili district, north of Sierra Leone. He has been a teacher for three years now.

This will be the fourth loan he has received from SMT/Kiva. With the first loan, he was able to buy a plot of land. With the second, he bought house-building materials such as corrugated iron, zinc, cement, sand, etc. With the third loan, Thomas started the construction of a house – three bedrooms, a parlor and a store. With this loan, he expects to complete the building process. Thomas is thus very happy about SMT/Kiva loans as they have enabled him do something many of his age cannot do.

loans.use: The completion of a house-building project.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells pastries at Atabadze near Elmina. Mary has received junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a petty trader.

Mary has been selling pastries since 2003. She is responsible for paying school fees for her children. Her loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients for the preparation of the pastries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: buy flour and more other ingredients for the preparation of  pastries

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and has five children.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  For almost thirty years, she has been preparing food to sell.  She prepares traditional Beninese meals of attasi, pates, gumbo sauce, and beans at her home.  Attasi and pates are both made out of corn.  While Beatrice is cooking her meals, goats, sheep, and chickens wander around her yard.  Her children help her prepare her meals when they are not in school.  Beatrice finishes cooking in late morning and then brings her food to a food stall on the side of a busy Porto-Novo street.  There she sells her food during the day.  

Beatrice has already acquired a from a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin.  This loan helped her to restock her goods and to start selling Beninese fabrics called pagnes.   Beatrice is seeking another loan in order to buy beans, gumbo, corn, and more fabrics.  In the future, Beatrice hopes to have the financial means to increase the variety of her products.

loans.use: Beans, gumbo, corn, and fabrics

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet T., the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi, is a 38-year-old lady who puts a great deal of determination and hard work into all of her business and general endeavors. She is a business lady with a hotel in Kitwe town along Mbarara-Bushenyi Road that has been running for six years. Juliet says that before she started preparing meals, she had only prepared tea and a few snacks, but with the help of loans, she was able to buy saucepans, forks, spoons and plates in addition to various foodstuffs that enabled her to expand her offerings. She is now able to make a net profit of 35,000 per week which enables her to save for her children’s education, food, health and clothing. 

Juliet is a mother of three children, a 20-year-old and an 18-year-old, both secondary school students, and a 13-month-old.  She dreams of owning a bigger hotel in town so that she can increase her customer base, and she is requesting a loan to help purchase more foodstuffs for resale in a boiled form in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna A. is 42 years old and mother to five children; the eldest is 19 years old. She is married and owns a rice field in Agusan Del Sur. Lorna is a new CEVI member and likes the program and monthly meetings. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy farm supplies. This loan will help Lorna achieve her goal, which is to be prosperous.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more yeast and firewood for brewing.  Keji is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more yeast and firewood for brewing

loans.name: Mawimbi Group

texts.en:
Nassor R., age 39, is married with three children who are 16, 14, and 11. All three of his children are in school. Nassor owns a charcoal business that he opened earlier this year. The business operates from 7 am until 8 pm every day. Currently, his business makes a profit of about US$ 20 a day, which he uses to pay school fees for his children.

This will be Nassor's first loan from Tujijenge. With the money, he will buy more charcoal to increase his stocks. He will sell this charcoal from his home to both retail and wholesale customers.

Nassor will share this loan with the members of his group, Mawimbi, which means "clouds" in Kiswahili. Most of the sixteen group members are food vendors; one is a fisherman, one sells juice, and another sells soap. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans, and meet once a week to make repayments, discuss their businesses, and share advice. In the picture, Nassor is second from the left (crouching down).

loans.use: Charcoal to increase stock of business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. K. is forty-five years old and married with five children who are all in school. She works together with her husband. She is working as a government servant in the education sector, but as a side business she runs a salon and a cosmetic shop. She has been in this business for over three years.

Harriet is requesting the loan with the aim of stocking more cosmetic products, like the different types of powder; that is, Johnson's sandalwood, Romance and others. She also wants to add more body sprays, creams, lotions, jellies, hair sprays, chemicals, etc. Her future dream is to expand her business. After buying most of the commodities to re-sell, she would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To stock more cosmetic products.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen Z. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Ellen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Sarah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC.
