She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica S. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has one infant and two school-aged children. Veronica owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family and to save for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora D. 30 años D. edad,vive con su esposo Ricardo y sus hijos Marcia (14) y Ricardo (10) en su casa propia.Gracias a sus buenas cualidades culinarias, se desempeña  desD. hace 15 años en  L. venta D. comida en el restaurant que posee en su casa. Los clientes frecuentan mucho su establecimiento ya que se sienten muy bien con L. atención y con el sabor D. todos los platillos que Yenny prepara, pues cocina todo con mucha dedicación y con los mejores ingredientes que pueD. obtener, es por esta razón  que esta pensando en hacer crecer su negocio. Además del restaurante, Yeny también venD. jugos al costado D. su negocio, con L. única finalidad D. abarcar todas las necesidades D. L. asidua clienteL. que L. visita diariamente.Aunque se encuentra en el cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma promete ser  puntual en sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad D. ingredientes para el negocio D. los jugos ya que esta pensando en ampliarlo  y así mejorar.
texts.en:
Yenny is a happy and hard-working 30 year old woman. She lives with her husband Ricardo and her children Marcia (14) and Ricardo (10) in a home that they own. Thanks to her good culinary skills, for the last 15 years she has worked selling food in the restaurant that she runs in her home. Customers visit her restaurant frequently because they feel good about the service and the taste of all the dishes that Yenny prepares. She is very committed to her cooking and uses the best ingredients that she can get. This is why she is thinking about growing her business. Besides the restaurant, Yenny also sells juices to the siD. of her business, with the goal of fulfilling all the needs of the assiduous clientele that visits her daily. Although this is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, she promises to be on time in her repayments. With the money from the loan she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients for the juice business, because she is thinking of expanding it and thus better her situation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month. In 2008, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase crates of sodas and packed juice to sell. Lucia is 31 years old and married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of sodas and packed juice to sell

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: Remberto cuenta con 27 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y cuenta con casa propia que está dotada de los principales servicios básicos. Su principal actividad es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia vagoneta, en la ruta local perteneciendo a la cooperativa de la localidad, contando con ruta y parada fija. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte. En el sector del transporte de pasajeros existe fuerte competencia, sin embargo su fortaleza radica en que trabaja en una ruta fija y cuenta con una parada fija perteneciendo a una cooperativa de transporte, quienes por su estabilidad y el buen servicio cuentan con bastante clientela que requieren de sus servicios, y cuya parada está estratégicamente ubicada frente al mercado central de la ciudad. El crédito que lo obtuvo lo destino a arreglos en su vagoneta. Remberto y su familiar cuentan con 4 créditos en la Institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, contando con crédito tan solo en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Remberto is 27 years old, single, has no children, and owns a home that is equipped with essential basic services. His main business activity is trasporting passengers in the station wagon that he owns. Remberto drives along a route that belongs to the local cooperative and has five years of experience. In the passenger transport sector there is strong competition, but Remberto has the advantage of operating on a route owned by the transportation cooperative, which is known for its stability and providing good service to its customers. His station is also strategically located in front of the city’s central market.

The loan he is requesting will be used for repairs to his station wagon. Remberto and his family have taken out four loans with the Institution. He has demonstrated an excellent payment history and has only requested loans from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn U. is 48 years old and she lives in Angk Sangkae village in Takeo province.  She and her husband, Mr. Thou Nop, are farmers who own 1.5 hectare to cultivate rice. Mrs. Khoeurn U. now is requesting 1,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming. With this loan they hope that they would be able to help her to increase the family income from their farmer. This couple has five children, three of whom are workers in a restaurant while two other are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 52-year-old married father of four children.  He does metal fabrication to earn a living and uses part of his profits to pay his two employees.   William is a hardworking man who is determined to improve his business and open other outlets. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for training him how to keep business records. His dream is to provide quality education for his children. Therefore, he has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To educate his children

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Brenda del Socorro G. M., tiene un negocio de venta de frutas ubicados a cuatro cuadras aledañas del mercado central en la esquina de la Ferretería Navarro ahí la señora G. M. tiene 10 años de estar operando en ese lugar su negocio empezo con  un capital de C$ 1,000.00, capital que fue una ayuda para ella de parte de su mamá.
La Señora Brenda G. vende frutas peladas en bolsas bananos, sandias, naranjas etc, de los cuales necesita los financiamientos para surtir su negocio.
Siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante tiene una niña de  que es la razón por la cual se esfuerza cada día mas trabaja de lunes a domingos de 8 de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde sin descansar un día a su niña se la trae al tramo junto con ella por que no tiene quien se la cuide lleva  dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel y siente que la hemos ayudado bastante por que al suave ha venido comprando sus  cositas que son útiles para ella en su casa además
texts.en:
Sra. Brenda del Socorro G. M. has a business selling fruit in the four blocks surrounding the central market. Her stand is located on the corner near the Navarro Hardware Store.

Sra. G. has ten years of experience running her business at this location. She started with capital worth 1000 NIO, which was assistance she received from her mother. Brenda sells bags of bananas, watermelons, oranges, and other fruits. She needs financing in order to restock her business.

Brenda has always strived to get ahead. She has a daughter who is the reason why she works hard every day. Brenda looks after her stand Monday through Sunday from 8am until 4pm without taking a day of rest. She brings her daughter with her because she does not have anyone to take care of her.

Brenda has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels the assistance she has received has gone smoothly in helping her buy things that are useful to her and for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & bags for her business

loans.name: Eunice De La Cruz

texts.es:
L. señora E. D. L. C. Morales Martinez, tiene L. edad D. 31 años vive con su compañero D. vida el cual es electricista, en el Barrio Juan Ramon PadilL., aun no se les ha hecho posibles el tener hijos debido a que planifican tener mejores condiciones económico-sociales que le brinden mejores condicione a futuros hijos, elL. trabaja como profesora desD. hace 2 años, y añora con mejorar sus condiciones D. vida para poder realizar sus propósitos D. vida.

Ellos actualmente habitan en un terreno que L. mama D. elL. le ofreció, el problema ha sido que ellos no cuentan con el capital necesario para terminar L. construcción D. su  terreno, es por esto que ellos solicitan un préstamo para L. compra D. los materiales D. construcción y culminar D. esta manera L. construcción del hogar, esperan se le apoye económicamente, D. esta manera a un corto plazo puedan considerar tener hijos y se complete L. familia.
texts.en:
E. D. L. C. Morales Martínez, 31, lives with her life partner, who is an electrician, in the Juan Ramón PadilL. neighborhood. They have no children yet because they want to be in better socio-economic conditions that will offer better living conditions to any future children. She has been a teacher for the last two years and yearns to improve her living conditions so that she can reach her life goals. They currently live on a piece of land that her mother offered. The problem is that they don’t have the necessary funds to finish building on it. For this reason, they are requesting funding to buy building materials and supplies to finish building their home. They hope that the funds will be granted so that they can start to plan to have children thus completing their family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou N. habite à Yoff Ngaparou. Elle est âgée de 47 ans et évolue dans le commerce de diverses marchandises comme les chaussures, les tissus, etc. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce secteur. Elle a choisi cette activité  a cause de son aspect lucratif car son principal objectif est la réalisation de profits pour satisfaire ses besoins. C’est dans le but d’avoir des revenus supplémentaires pour prendre en charge la scolarité des enfants qu’elle projette de construire une chambre et de la mettre en location. Son soucis  est d’améliorer la situation scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou N. lives in the Ngaparou borough of Yoff. She is 47 years old and is engaged in trading a variety of merchandise such as shoe wear, clothing fabric, etc. She has an accumulated five years’ experience in this domain, which she chose because of its lucrative aspects. Her main objective is to make profits to satisfy her needs. She wants to build a room she can rent out, which will provide her with additional income to cover her children’s tuition costs. Her main concern is to improve the children’s schooling situation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building a room for rent

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. Two of his children also work to help support the family. He has been working in the agriculturA. industry for over 20 years. He has owned his own farm since 1993. He has one person who assists him part time. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in new tools for his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the politicA. and sociA. challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financiA. services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in new tools for his work

loans.name: Buenalyn

texts.en:
The loans that Buenalyn P. has obtained from ASHI since she became a member in 2005 are a great source of cash flow for her family. She was able to finance different income-generating activities and has made small improvements to her family's standard of living. Just last year, Buenalyn started a business buying and selling silver accessories in partnership with her eldest child, Renalyn, who is 30 years old. With this business, Buenalyn and her daughter have profited fairly well and have augmented the income of her husband, who is a hired driver.

Most of all, Buenalyn is happy for the opportunity of financing her own business because she became productive, which improved her temperament. In the future, she hopes to sustain her business and make it stable. Using loans obtained through ASHI, she would like to have her own store in a public place to increase her sales turnover and profit to support her dream of improving her family's quality of life, including her two children who have their own families.

loans.use: to purchase a larger volume of silver fashion accessories for retail

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria tiene 35 años de edad,  la socia es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo de 15 años de edad; La socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y ella poco a poco lo hace crecer, es una mujer muy competente y muy decidida a triunfar, ella es madre y padre para su hijo y sola lo ayuda en los estudios y en todo lo que le pueda hacer falta, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una congeladora para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank YANAPAKUY. She lives in the district of Santiago, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She's a 35-year-old single mother with a 15-year-old son. She has a small restaurant which is growing little by little. She's a competent woman who's very dedicated to success. She's mother and father to her son and she helps him all by herself with his studies and with anything else he might need. Maria is asking for this loan to buy a freezer for her restaurant. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan, and she promises to pay off the debt within the established period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann N.’s aspiration in life is to see her children living a comfortable kind of life in the future with their own families. That is why, now that they are still young (their ages range are from 8 months to 12 years), she and her fisherman husband try to sustain their small business and continue to work hard growing it, hoping that one day it will become stable and profitable.

Mary Ann, being the one in charge of the family cash flow and budget, sees to it that food and education are always the priority among other expenses. Though it was easy for her to do that, she also wants to provide her children with nice clothing and other things. Yet, for now, she has to focus on her desire to strengthen their foundation through a good quality of education that they can obtain from school until they graduate from college. Then they will be able to have more opportunities to enhance their own lives someday.

Nevertheless, Mary Ann also believes that, in partnership with her husband, one day their fishing and fish-selling business will grow through the loans she can obtain through ASHI, being one of its members. Then, through their business proceeds, she would have money to buy nice things for her children and that would at least inspire them to study harder and maintain a good performance at school.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and a fishing boat to increase the volume of their catch

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo B. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 43 years old, married and has 4 very young children. Eduardo owns and operates a business  raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 24 años, vive en Primavera de Duran ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), trabaja como servicio al cliente en la mañana y tarde, pero en las noches se dedica a vender comida para tener oto ingreso adicional. 

Después de llegar de su trabajo de servicio al clientes, el va a cocinar en su casa para vender en la noche hamburguesa, papas con pollo frito y colas. Las vende hasta las 22h00pm. Aunque no tienen hijos ni esta casado el quiere ahorrar dinero para construir mejor su casa ya que es de caña y tablas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar cemento, bloques y hierros para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su casa terminada y dedicarse solo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and lives in Primera de Duran (a semi-urban zone with a crumbling ecology on the outskirts of Guayaquil). He works providing a transport service in the morning and afternoon, but at night he works selling food in order to have another income. After arriving from his transport work, Jorge goes to his house to cook hamburgers and fried chicken with potatoes, to sell later at night. He sells food until 10pm. Although he doesn't have children and isn't married he wants to save money to improve his house, which is made from reeds and planks. With this loan Jorge wants to buy cement, blocks and tools to better construct his house. In the future he wants to finish his house and dedicate himself solely to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora María Martha tiene 41 años, ella es casada,  y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 13 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja actualmente en Costa Rica. Maria se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada, cabe señalarse ella ya tiene veinte años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en el municipio. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito principalmente encargos. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de dos pacas de ropa usada, ya que este producto es el que se está vendiendo más en los últimos días. El préstamo mejorara sus ganancias, ya que actualmente posee varios pedidos de pantalones jeans usados, que es lo que compraría con el préstamo. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el nuevo mercado en el cual pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
María Martha, age 41, is married and has two children. They are 9 and 13 years old. Her husband currently works in Costa Rica. María buys and sells new and used clothes. She has had this business for 20 years. She also has an established customer base in the municipality. Most of her sales are for cash. Nevertheless, she also sells on credit, primarily with orders. This business was born from the necessity of increasing the family income to economically improve. She wants to use this loan to buy two bundles of used clothing. Recently, this product is what she has been selling the most. The loan will improve her income because she currently has various orders for used jeans, which she will buy with the loan. Her dream is to buy a stall in the new market where she would be able to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 7 Group

texts.en:
Fani is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer 7 (Rebirth). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Fani is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products, like beauty aids and cosmetics. She also wants to buy a hair dryer and hair washer. She has a beauty salon, a little boutique and she is a professional masseuse. She will use the profits to invest in saving toward the future to have a massage school. She enjoys doing her favorites activities like writing, acting and singing. Her most difficult challenge is to print a book she wrote called Change your life.

loans.use: To buy beauty and cosmetics products and miscellaneous items

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Salmin M. is in his late fifties and is married with six children. He runs a food stall where he sells basic groceries as well as tea. Salmin has been operating this stall between 6 am and 9 pm for 17 years. The stall earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be Salmin's 6th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. His previous loans were used to repair his stall and to increase his stock, loans which he has successfully repaid. Salmin aims to use this loan to increase his stock in rice and in powdered milk, which he sells with his tea.

Salmin will share this loan with his loan group, New Africa, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture, Salmin can be seen in the last row, wearing a white cap.

loans.use: Increase stock of rice and powdered milk

loans.name: Magaret Efua Mansah Kakraba

texts.en: Margaret Efua Mansah Kakraba E. sells "banku" and fish at Elmina. Margaret Efua Mansah has no educational background. She is a widow and has six dependents. She responsibly takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more corn to prepare "banku" (fermented corn dough) for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of selling maize and cassava flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Mary is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie P. lives in the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 56 years old, married and has three grown children. For the last 10 years, she has made a living running a grocery store. She earns about 3,200 PHP a month from her work.

In 2001, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid 20 previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her store. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm C., 41, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. C. is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1.30 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 4.40 per day. C. has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 2 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 67 on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of bath soap

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz M. H. is married and has five children: four sons and a daughter. Her husband is M. H., a street hawker who sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart along different streets of the city. The family is from Multan, famous in Pakistan for its shrines and hot weather. They live in the neighborhood of Kher-abad in a two-room brick house. Shahnaz moved here after her marriage.

For the past five years Shahnaz has operated a boutique, which she runs to supplement the family’s income. She displays stitched and embroidered clothes in her boutique to attract customers. She has a good number of customers from neighboring areas and also from the cloth markets, who give her regular orders every month.

Shahnaz’s two elder sons work with her and help in expanding her boutique business. They collect orders for her from different shops in the markets, and Shahnaz completes them on time to earn an income.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan, her first from Kiva’s partner Asasah, for her boutique. She is confident that an investment will definitely put her business into a more profitable position. With the loan she will buy clothes, patterns, and thread in bulk, which will help her in making more dresses and increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy clothes, patterns, and thread in bulk

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman who lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (variety) store and pig fattening. Her husband Ignacio G., who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 25 and 38 years old; all of her children have their own family now. 

Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Rosita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Meilyn Xiomara

texts.es:
Es una joven de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 5 añitos por quien lucha para darle lo mejor, su mama le cuida a su hijo en tiempos de su ausencia por su trabajo,   labora como docente de educaciòn primaria desde hace 6 años, es una persona dedicada, responsable  y muy queridas por sus compañeros y vecinos.  
Solicita su primer crèdito mediante la ayuda de Kiva, para utilizarlo  en  compra de materiales de construcciòn y de esta manera terminar de construir una habitacuiòn en casa de su mamà que es donde actualmente habita.  

Su proposito principal es brindar un hogar a su hijo donde este pueda tener las condiciones basicas.
texts.en:
Meilyn Xiomara is a young woman who is 28 years old and a single mother. Her son is 5 years old and she fights to provide for him as best she can. Her mother cares for her son when she is away for work. She has been working for six years as a primary school teacher. She is a dedicated and responsible woman who is very beloved by her friends and neighbors.

She is requesting her first loan through Kiva in order to buy construction materials so that she can finish building a room onto her mother's house, which is where she currently lives.

Her primary goal is to offer her son a home equipped with the basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María del Carmen; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a realizar trabajos manuales como recordatorios, sabanas, paneras entre otros más la socia trabaja a pedido dependiendo de lo que le soliciten a la vez la socia trabaja en el municipio de Santiago lleva ya un buen tiempo en este trabajo el cual le gusta ya que mediante este la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como telas, hilos, agujas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 37, is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has a son.  She makes handicrafts like keepsakes, sheets and bread baskets, among others.  She works depending on orders she has; she’s also employed by the City of Santiago.  She’s had this job for some time now and she enjoys it because she’s able to support her family through it.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the business like: fabric, thread and needles, among others.  She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business like: fabric, thread and needles, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood carvings and batik fabric

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 30-year-old housewife, married to Sami, 35 years old. She has four children. Sanaa has always wanted to do something to support her husband, but since she wants to dedicate all of her time to raising their kids, she decided to open a barber shop for him since he has previous experience in the field.

Sanaa and her husband Sami took their first loan two years ago to open a barber shop and they have successfully managed it and gained a wide base of customers. Sanaa’s husband appears in the photograph, since she preferred not to have her picture published online.

Now Sanaa is applying for another loan in order to expand their barber shop by adding one more seat and  buying a steam machine to be able to serve more clients in their area.

loans.use: To add one more seat and  buy a steam machine for their barber shop.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem lives in Kasur, which is known for its tannery industry. It is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is an old historic city. She is married to R. A. who has a dairy business. He has some buffalos at his home. He gets up early in the morning and gets milk from his buffalos. He then sells that milk to his community clients and generates income for the family.  Tasleem herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. In her spare time, she also supports her husband by taking care of his cattle and getting milk from them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to expand his dairy business. By purchasing another buffalo, he will be able to increase the milk production to sell to more customers to earn better profits. Tasleem is hopeful that a loan will help her husband make more profits and improve the living standards of his family. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tasleem.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyneang K., 33, is a widow with two daughters, who attend school. Her elderly mother also lives with her. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sreyneang sells porridge and Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok, which is considered the national dish of Cambodia and can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. In addition, she also weaves silk in her free time. Sreyneang is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a divorced woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two months, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Hadija faces a major challenge of the high cost of buying goods in her business.  She dreams of buying her own plot of land and building a hotel in the future.  

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and kitchen utensils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 52 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has a retail store that she has operated for almost two years. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly and she's asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She also sells personal products in their village. She hopes to start another income-generating source for her to provide the family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell

location.town: Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabe

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has six dependents.  Her husband is a farmer.  She sells food items such as kako, tomatoes, pepper, onions, eggs, spices and others at Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. 

As part of her responsibilities of the home she feeds and clothes the children.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more food items for sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña María del Socorro pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostinal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo ₡600 000 (Seiscientos mil colones), ya que los miembros de la empresa necesitan respaldar mejor los documentos y brindar un mejor servicio a los socios de la empresa, por medio de la compra de dos computadores e impresoras.
Ella asegura que la demanda de crédito a aumentado muchísimo y que por eso es necesario invertir en tecnología para que la empresita crezca.
Doña María de Socorro asegura que está empresa ha apoyado efectivamente las necesidades de los miembros de la ECC, y da oportunidad de crecimiento y bienestar a los socios.
texts.en:
María del Socorro belongs to the Ostinal community credit enterprise (CCE) and is requesting a loan for 600,000 CRC. Membership has grown significantly, and the CCE needs to maintain good customer service by better documenting client information. María  hopes to do this by buying two computers and printers.

Demand for credit has grown so much that María believes the CCE must invest in technology to continue growing. She is confident that the organization has been effectively meeting the needs of its clients and providing its members with opportunities for growth and success.

loans.use: To purchase laptop and PC computers.

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.ru: Sarkhan yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Lachin ,seychas projivayet v Absheron regione. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Sarkhan 33 qoda. Uje 2 qoda kak on otkril kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyego kafe. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy i pomog yemu otkrit eto kafe.
texts.en: Sarkhan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Lachin who now lives in the Absheron region.  He is single and has no children.  Sarkhan is 33 years old.  He opened a cafe two years ago.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy chairs and tables for his cafe.  He started this business with his uncle who helped him open the cafe.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Rosa Hortencia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por las afueras de la parroquia Turi, lugar que es reconocido por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que se  puede observar desde allí gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy amable, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 35 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 9 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano y labora en hierro forjado. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá pero independientemente. 

La Señora. Rosa trabaja en su casa en la elaboración de artesanías en cerámica, aprendió este oficio por habilidad y lleva 12 años en él, sus productos los vende a su su selecta clientela, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario especifico.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piezas de cerámica, pinturas, lacas y otros materiales para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es incrementar y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “El Mirador” communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of Turi Parish, a place known for being a scenic overlook from where one can see a large portion of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents are very kind, dedicated to commerce, livestock raising and agriculture.

Rosa is 35 years old, married and has two children who are 9 and 7 years of age and attend the local little school.  Her husband is an artisan working in wrought iron.  They do not have a house of their own; they live in her mother’s house but independently.

Rosa works at home making ceramic crafts.  She learned this occupation through ability and has been in it for 12 years.  She sells her items to a select clientele.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule.

She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she’ll use the loan to buy some ceramic items, paint, lacquer and other materials to continue with her business.  Her goal is to increase business and to grow in it.

loans.use: to buy clay objects, paint, lacquer and other materials.

loans.name: Jose Isaac

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el Jose Isaac se dedica   a laborar como agente de seguridad en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace cuatro años. Es casado y con dos personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Jose Isaac ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito que lo utilizara para gasto de operacion de una hematoma en el hombro de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose Isaac works as a security guard at a state institution in the Managua municipality.  He has been doing this for four years.

He is married, and he has two people under his care.  He provides his family with the necessary living conditions.

Jose Isaac has come to Ceprodel to request a loan.  He will use the loan to pay for the expense of an operation for a hematoma on his wife’s shoulder.

loans.use: to pay for a personal medical expense.

loans.name: Mauricio Mardoqueo

texts.es:
Mauricio, es empleado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, él está trabajando desde junio del 2008 en una empresa donde se encarga de monitorear los medidores del consumo de energía eléctrica, trabaja todos los días y debe caminar para recorrer las viviendas y controlando los medidores de energía de cada una.
Él necesita comprar uniformes y zapatos escolares para sus dos hijos, por tal motivo invertirá un préstamo en este gasto, garantizándole a sus hijos para que cuenten con lo necesario para su estudio. Su aspiración es que se superen los hijos, y en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en: Mauricio is employed and lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8.  Since June of 2008, he has been working in a business which monitors the electric energy consumption meters.  He works everyday and must travel to the homes and read the electricity meters of each one.  He needs to buy uniforms and school shoes for his two children, and for this reason he will invest the loan in this expense, making sure his children have what is necessary for their education.  His aspiration is that his children will succeed and in the future become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms and school shoes for his two children.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, and an enterprising business man. He is married to Magdalene who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. He has been offering motorcycle transport as the primary business and quarry mining as the secondary business for three years. He has a monthly income of KES 25,000 (Kenyan shillings) which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to service the motorbike and employ labor in the quarry business. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children up to university level. He hopes to purchase another quarry which will increase his income.

loans.use: To service the motorbike and employ labor in the quarry business.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Generación Centro está formado por 10 mujeres quienes son amigas y conocidas, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, tiene riqueza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es culta y amable como nuestras socias quienes son personas muy alegres, carismáticas y trabajadoras que se dedican a varias actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Lourdes, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su matrimonio ha concebido una hija de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios a una empresa privada, la casa en la que habitan es el fruto del sacrificio conyugal.

Doña Lourdes se dedica al cuidado de su hija que aun esta pequeña y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar labora hace 10 años en el venta de productos Yanbal y hace 3 años también vende los productos Onmilife, sus productos los vende a sus amigas y conocidas. 

 Su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de cosméticos Yanbal y productos naturales Onmilife para  crecer en esta actividad. 

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.

Las tres fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de tres socias que por motivos personales no pudieron estar presentes, al momento de tomar la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Generación Centro” communal bank has 10 women members who are friends and know each other.  They live in various parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important.  It has natural, architectural and cultural wealth.  Its varied cuisine conquers the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its residents are cultured and kind just like our members who are very cheerful, charismatic and hard working and who are dedicated to various activities that make it possible for them to contribute to their homes’ economy.

One of the members is Lourdes.  She lives in the city of Cuenca.  This is the first loan she’s taken out in the communal bank that she was invited to join by her mother.

Our member is 31 years old, married and has a 4-year-old daughter.  Her husband’s a driver by profession and works for a private firm.  The house they live in is the fruit of their labor as a couple.

Lourdes is dedicated to caring for her daughter who is still little but to help with household expenses she’s been selling Yanbal products for the last three years; she also sells Omnilife products.  She sells her products to friends and acquaintances.

She will use her loan to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics and Omnilife brand natural products to grow in her activity.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

The three small attached photos are of three members who due to personal reasons were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics and Omnilife brand natural products.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Irenea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Irenea has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a fruit seller. He sells fresh seasonal fruits to his clients at reasonable rates. He is very fair in his dealings with the customers. 
Riaz is a housewife who spends her time staying at home doing her household responsibilities. 
She has given birth to 2 daughters and a son. She couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints. As a result, they remain illiterate. 
Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family and it is very necessary for him to improve his earnings. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Riaz is very confident that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and improves her family’s life style. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Riaz”.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for sale

loans.name: Carmen Adriana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Carmen es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señorita Carmen tiene 24 años de edad y es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 4 años y un bebé de 3 meses de edad. Vive con su madre compartiendo los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a cuidar de sus hijos y a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y Avon, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su quinto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos y así ampliar su negocio.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Floreciendo". She lives near the Parish of Del Valle (Cuenca). This is a cold climate area and the people are dedicated to raising livestock and agriculture. Many set out daily to the city of Cuenca to work in their different business. The people maintain their culture and the traditions of their ancestors.

Carmen is 24 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children, aged 4 and a 3-month old baby. She lives with her mother and she shares the household expenses. They do not have a house of their own, so they rent their space.

She does the household chores, takes care of her children, and she sells Yanbal and Avon brand cosmetics. It is a business she has had for the past year. She works from Sunday to Sunday although she does not have a fixed schedule.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and married with three children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling firewood.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Pilar Marisol

texts.es:
Pilar de 43 años, una mujer trabajadora, que a pesar de ser mujer soltera ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
Su negocio es una pequeña tienda que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Escogió esta actividad porque lo heredo de sus padres.
Su horario es de lunes a domingos, inicia desde las 6:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia de su sector, ya que en la actualidad se incrementaron los robos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de víveres como: lácteos, azúcar, arroz, papas, bebidas, etc.
Su sueño es que su negocio se amplia en otro lugar de la urbe.
texts.en: Pilar is 43 years old and a hardworking woman who in spite of being single has be able to get ahead with "God's help" (la ayuda de Dios). She has a small store which is located in the front part of her house. She chose this business because she inherited it from her parents. She works Mondays to Sundays from 6:00am until 22:00pm. Her difficulty is the crime in her area as recently the number of robberies have increased. She is asking for a loan to buy food staples such as: dairy products, sugar, rice, potatoes, beverages, etc. Her dream is that her business expand elsewhere in the city.

loans.use: to buy food staples such as dairy products, sugar, rice, potatoes, beverages, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marites is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marites has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Marites has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, vive en casa propia que está ubicada en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco Alto del Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la  Región Piura a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.  El Caserío Hualtaco es un caserío mediano con deseos de superación.

La actividad que desarrolla Felipe es la Agricultura contando a la fecha con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón, el cual cosecha semanalmente.  Cosecha 8 bolsas de limón por semana, además cuenta con 8 cabezas de ganado con lo cual asume sus obligaciones familiares, su esposa cría aves de corral y lo apoya en las actividades que realiza, existe una buena relación familiar. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y familiares. 

Felipe desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón y así poder obtener una mejor producción y por lo tanto logra un mejor precio de sus productos y seguir creciendo en su actividad. Para ello ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old and lives with his partner and 3 children. He lives in his own house which is located in the village of El Porvenir Hualtaco Alto in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the region of Piura, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the departament of Lambayeque.  El Caserío Hualtaco is a medium sized village with a desire to excel.

Felipe is a farmer with so far 1.0 ha of agrictural land, planted with lemon trees which he harvests on a weekly basis. He harvests 8 bags of lemons a week and in addition has 8 heads of cattle with which he covers his family obligations. His partner breeds poultry and supports him in whatever he does. They have a good relationship. With the income he covers both his personal and family expenses.

Felipe wants to buy fertilizers for his lemon trees to thus obtain a better harvest and a better price for his produce and so continue to grow the business.
For now he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN).

loans.use: to buy fetilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 41-year-old enterprising businessman.  He is married to Phyllis, who is a tailor. They are blessed with three children aged 10, 9, and 5. Simon has been running a retail shop for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he combines with his wife's income to support his family.

Simon is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his shop.

He hopes to educate his children up to the university level and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Marife has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She is also buying and selling electronic loads from several networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Akayi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est une célibataire ayant un enfant à sa charge. Akayi a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Akayi vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges et ceux de son enfant à charge. Depuis huit ans, Akayi prépare et vend du couscous dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Akayi vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Cette activité lui génère des revenus non négligeables et lui permet d'assurer ses diverses charges. Akayi achète ses produits dans son quartier. En vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Akayi et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts été bien remboursé.
texts.en: DIEU EST GRAND ("God is great") is a group of three people living in the same area. The representative of the group Akayi (with her hand raised in the photo) is thirty-three years old and single, with one child in her care. Akayi stopped attending school at the primary level. Akayi lives alone with her child in her care and provides for her various expenses and those of her child by herself. For eight years, Akayi has prepared and sold couscous in her area. At the same time as she practices this occupation, Akayi sells recharge cards for cell phones. This activity brings her non negligible profits and allows her to provide for various expenses. Akayi buys her products in her area. With an eye to strengthening their working capital and their activity and to better respond to the demands of their clients, Akayi and the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND are asking for a third loan from Alidé. Their first two loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards and spices for couscous preparation.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de platanos desde hace 26 años y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener una buena cosecha.

loans.use: compra de fertilantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy a computer.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.en:
For the past five years I have dedicated myself to selling a local style of fried fish accompanied with fried plantain slices. The fish sells very quickly because our customers like it for its taste and health benefits. My business helps generate income to be able to help cover family expenses and pay my employees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace cinco años me dedico a la venta de pescado frito estilo lago de Yojoa, son fritos acompañados de tajaditas de platano verde, este pescado se vende rapido ya que nos gusta consumir bastante pescado por lo saludable y sabroso. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para poder atender a mi familia en los gastos y pagar a mis empleadas.

loans.use: Buy fresh fish, cabbage, onion, plantains, oils, etc.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive is 75 years old.  She has raised eight children.  The main source of income in Nive’s family has always been her vegetable garden.  All of her children were put through school by the produce sales from her garden.  When Nive joined SPBD over a year ago, she had decided it was time to launch a more formal business and hopefully increase her earnings.  She took out an initial loan from SPBD to start a flea market stand.  Now, she sells not only homegrown vegetables but also sells Samoan handicrafts made by local villagers and Samoan cocoa raised by her neighbors.  Nive wants to take out a second loan to buy more goods for her stall as well as to buy seeds and tools for her own garden.  She says that she is very happy with the program and that the loans have helped her create a business that she wouldn’t have been able to otherwise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her flea market stall (handicrafts, Samoan cocoa, vegetable seeds and gardening tools)

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
K. Jacqueline is a dynamic 41-year-old woman. Jacqueline is divorced and has 7 children. She lives with her children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She opened her restaurant 6 years ago when she divorced. She has successfully managed her restaurant and has been able to take care of her 3 younger children alone.

Jacqueline’s activities are growing fast and she wants to acquire new equipment to enlarge the space of her restaurant and offer better service to her customers. Jacqueline, who heard about AE&I in February, 2004, joined the AE&I microcredit program then. She has been a good performer. She is ambitious and well organized.

loans.use: Kouakou Jacqueline wants the loan to acquire new equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Senora Nilda B. is married to Jose Gerardo Gonzalez. She has a 3 year old son, and she works selling various household items, including pots and pans, plastic goods, glasses, plates, table clothes, etc. Her business is located in the Luque Market. She has been there for 2 years, and has a good customer base. She is requesting the loan to increase her inventory and her average sales. Her husband is a brick layer and works as an independent contractor. On his free days he helps with the business. She used the loan she received to buy merchandise such as kitchen furniture and haberdashery items.

La señora Nilda Bordón está casada con el señor José Gerardo González, tiene un hijo de 3 años y se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería y bazar. En él ellos tienen ventas de cacerolas, artículos de plásticos, vasos, cubiertos, platos etc. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de Luque donde tiene una buena clientela y opera en el ramo desde hace dos años. Ella solicitó el crédito para aumentar su inventario y así acrecentar su promedio de ventas. Su marido, quien es albañil y trabaja en forma independiente, en sus días libres le ayuda con la atención del negocio. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mercaderías como ser menajes de cocina y artículos de mercería.

loans.use: Buy merchandise - kitchen furniture, plates, table clothes, plates, thread, needles, ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Aslam

texts.en: Mohammad Aslam lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He has a retail shop, and his business is the only source of income for his family. He lost two of his young sons during the war in Afghanistan, and his other two sons are small and in school. He is responsible for his family. He wants to increase his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, baskets, and some extra purchases. He wants to make a good income and help his family more.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, and baskets.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim K. T., age 52, works raising and selling pigs at the market. Her husband works his land growing crops, earning around $2.60 each day. They have five children, some who are employed at a garment factory and some who are married. Khim would like to request a loan of $400 in order to purchase more pigs to expand her business to generate additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Wasswa Iii Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with five children. She has a market stall where she sells raw food. She intends to pay school fees for the children with the extra profits earned from this loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and expand her market business

loans.name: Kiryoowa Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Phida N.. She is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan to buy poultry feeders and drinkers. Phida is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 1 child. Each week, Phida makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child. Phida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more chicks and the loan was paid back on time.

Phida is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Hawa M., Annet G., and Joyce B.. Sarah N. has a poultry business and wants to buy chicken feed. Hawa M. is currently operating a business running a salon and wants a loan to buy more salon equipment. Annet G. operates a piggery business and wants to buy more piglets. Joyce B. is currently in the business of pig rearing and is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and increase profits

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is the mother of four boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. Juliana has been running a beauty parlor in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal for ten years. Her salon offers a variety of services such as nail care and hair care and includes nail polish, acrylic nails, hair cuts, hair dying and the like. Currently, the entrepreneur has a well established clientele, and she expects it to keep growing.

Juliana is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of materials which are necessary for her to carry out her work. The entrepreneur wants to increase her revenue so as to put aside money to support her children’s education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a lot of materials to keep running a beauty salon.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Elizabeth's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and is single with 1 child, age 1. Elizabeth owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanahawa, who has a business dealing in charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells baby clothing, bowls, and material. She is married but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient to support Mary and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling baby clothes, bowls, and material.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola sells cosmetics and perfumes at different offices and markets. She sells her products on credit. Her clients pay her either every day, or on a weekly or every fortnight basis. Her house is located in the area Bolognia in the city of La Paz. She rents her house and this is the first time she is requesting a loan with Impro. The loan will be use to increase her working capital and to buy more merchandise (Perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, creams and others). She tells us that the demand of her products has increased and she has many potential clients that if she serves them properly for sure her income will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Paola se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes en las oficinas y mercados. Otorga su producto a crédito, para poder cobrar cada día, a la semana o cada quincena. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en Alquiler Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito será destinado para aumentar su capital de Trabajo y comprar más mercadería (Perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes, cremas y otros), pues ella indica que la demanda por dichos productos ha aumentado y tiene muchos clientes potenciales que si los atiende adecuadamente con seguridad sus ingresos mejorarán.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her perfume and cosmetics business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija Sambalukamba is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She has four children. Her business is to sell bedcovers and clothes. She purchases inventory from the Mchikichini petty business market and sells it to customers in the Mbagala area in Temeke Dar Es Salaam. She is requesting a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y 2 D. sus 5 hijos. Hace 10 años buscó su propia fuente D. ingresos, que le permitiera ser un sostén más D. su hogar, es así que, junto a varias personas que compartían la misma visión decidieron fundar un mercadillo cercano a su barrio, para que cada uno ocupara un puesto y pueda vender lo que  desee, entonces, por su parte decidió vender comida y desD. ese entonces elabora desayunos y almuerzos todos los días, excepto los fines D. semana, días que descansa, ya que su jornada diaria consiste en levantarse a las 5 D. la mañana, comprar y preparar la comida que ha D. vender  hasta las 6 D. la tarD., donD. deja todo sus utensilios limpios y listos para el día siguiente, ella ya está acostumbrada a esta forma D. vida y disfruta D. el hecho D. tener su propia fuente D. ingreso. 
Pascuala se esfuerza porque  quiere seguir apoyando a los dos menores D. sus hijos que todavía estudian.
Solicita un préstamo con el que se implementará D. ingredientes, comprando por sacos el arroz y el azúcar, que es lo más utiliza, y evitar que el alza D. precios le ocasione menores ganancias, su mira es seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two of their five children. Ten years ago she looked for a way to earn her own income, one that would allow her to help in the household costs. This was how she, together with several people who shared the same vision, decided to start a small market in their neighborhood. Each person has their own small stand and can sell what they want. Pascuala decided to sell food and ever since then she has prepared breakfasts and lunches every day, except on the weekends when she rests. She gets up daily at 5am to buy and prepare the food that she will sell until 6 in the afternoon, after which she cleans all of her utensils so that she's ready for the following day. She is now accustomed to this schedule and way of life, and she enjoys having her own source of income. Pascuala works hard to support her two youngest children, who still attend school. She is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase wholesale the ingredients she uses most, such bags of rice and sugar. Her vision is to continue to grow her business and make it better.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WHOLESALE THE INGREDIENTS SHE USES MOST IN THE DAILY MEALS SHE PREPARES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: A. Jamshed was born in 1986 in the Spitamen region. He is a master of TV and audio repair.  He has a repair shop where he works with his brother. He has worked in the present business for 4 years. In addition, he trades in spare parts and TV-audio accessories. Mr. A. Jamshed applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3600 STJ (USD $1075) for 4 months to increase his work area. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To increase his work area

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs.Touch M. is a villager in Ponlai Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Horng Chhoun, are farmers. He is shown on the right of the photo.

She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living.  The soil in their fields has become infertile and it is having a negative effect on their crop. They do not have much money to improve the fields. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Touch M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to upgrade the soil and make the crop more productive. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field to make crops more productive.

loans.name: Doris Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Doris tiene 53 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama primero de Mayo, del colegio 2 andenes al sur, su esposo es jubilado lo cual recibe su pensión mensual, tiene dos hijos los cuales están casados y son independientes, su negocio es una disco móvil que se llama Extremo la tiene desde hace nueve años, la cual inicio con su hijo mayor con la ayuda de su papa, lo cual el se fue fuera del país lo cual ahora la administra ella. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar el porche. A futuro es comprar mejores equipos para que tenga mejor sonido la disco móvil, y así poder tener mas  contratos, y obtener mejores ganancias, para mejorar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 53 years old and lives two blocks south of the high school in the First of May neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension. She has two children who are married and financially independent. Her business is a disco called “Extremo” (“Extreme”). She began the business nine years ago with her elder son. As he has moved out of the country, she currently manages the business by herself. She requests this loan to purchase construction materials to remodel the porch which houses the disco. In the future, Doris would like to invest in better equipment to upgrade the sound quality of the disco. She will then be able to get more contracts and increase her profits so that she can continue to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel the porch

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
