Ofelia E. is 45 years old. She’s married to Miguel Bogado of 46. They have 5 children. She has owned a shop for 16 years. Ofelia began selling used clothes at a local market and was very successful. With time, she and her husband bought a truck to provide their customers with a freight service that was used to purchase products directly from the factories, being cement one of their main products, which they sell as retailers and wholesalers. The loan will be used to purchase cement in bulk for retailing. Their project includes buying another truck to satisfy the demand of their fixed clientele for load transport. It is their desire to live in a country with less corruption so more business companies could invest in the local market, which would generate more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Ofelia E. con 45 años de edad, está casada con el señor Miguel Bogado de 46 años. Ambos son padres de 5 hijos. Se dedica al comercio hace más de 16 años, comenzó vendiendo ropas usadas en el mercado, el cual tuvo mucho éxito y con el tiempo se compraron un camión con el cual realizan servicios de fletes y también es aprovechado para realizar compra de productos directamente desde las fabricas, como por ejemplo el cemento, el cual es comercializado al por mayor y menor. El dinero del préstamo será destinado a la compra de cemento en cantidad para su posterior venta. El proyecto que tienen es la compra de un camión más ya que cuentan con clientela segura para el servicio de transporte de cargas. Desean un país con menos corrupción para que haya mayor interés de empresarios extranjeros en invertir en el paisa para generar mayores fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase cement

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two sons - 11 and 12 years old. She sells children's clothing at the city market. Her gross monthly income is 9,000 UAH.

Irina has been in this business for 5 years. She used to sell clothes working for other small-business owners. Then she decided to start her own business. She is a very joyful and enthusiastic person. She works hard in spite of any difficulties she might have. Three month ago Irina got seriously injured in a car accident. She had to pay for her medical treatment by herself and took some money out of business. Now, the loan that she is asking for, 5,000 UAH, would help her to increase her assortment of goods and sustain her business.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es socia del Bancomunal mi Buen Pastor.
Micaela es casada, tiene 77 años, cuatro hijos, todos mayores que están casados.
Estudió cosmetología, puso una peluquería  donD. trabajo quince años, pero los líquidos son demasiado fuertes,  afectando su salud, le empezaron a salir ronchas en el cuerpo, y  dejó personal a cargo D. su peluquería, pero con el tiempo tuvo que cerrar. Ella se dedicó a vender productos D. belleza por catalogo, llegando a destacar en las ventas.   
DesD. que esta en Finca tiene mas facilidad para trabajar, a pesar D. su edad ella tiene ganas D. seguir trabajando, en el Bancomunal tiene muchas amigas, es como una familia para ella.   
Micaela solicita un crédito D. 1800 soles, para compra D. cosméticos y cremas D. rostro.
El sueño D. Micaela es volver a poner su peluquería.
texts.en:
Micaela is a member of the communal bank “Mi Buen Pastor” (My Good Shepherd). She is married, is 77 years old, and has four children, all of whom are grown and married. She studied cosmetology and opened a hair salon, where she worked for fifteen years. However, the chemicals are very strong and they affected her health; she started to get rashes on her skin. She left personnel in charge of the salon, but she eventually had to close it. She began selling beauty products from catalogs and excelled in her sales. Since she has been with FINCA, she’s had an easier time working. Despite her age, she wants to continue working. She has a lot of friends in the communal bank; it’s like a family to her. Micaela is requesting a loan of 1,800.00 soles to buy cosmetics and face creams. Micaela’s dream is to open her hair salon again.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Micaela is requesting a loan of 1,800.00 soles to buy cosmetics and face creams.

loans.name: Martina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Martina Tellez es una feliz dama que ha iniciado su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante llevando el bienestar a su casa de habitación la cual necesita de su apoyo.

Es importante destacar que como todo negocio en proceso de desarrollo, la pulpería de la señora Martina requiere de inversión en la compra de los productos y por esta sencilla razón es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de la mercadería y de este modo salir adelante logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martina Tellez is a happy woman who has started her own grocery store in the municipality of Nagarote in Leon, Nicaragua. She has been able to overcome her obstacles and bring a sense of well-being to her home, which needs her support. It is important to highlight that like all developing businesses, Martina has to invest in her store by purchasing more products. For this simple reason she has asked for Ceprodel’s help in purchasing merchandise. In this way she will get ahead and gain the satisfaction of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: Martha Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Martha Nelly M. R. tiene 37 años, vive en el caserío de Bellavista, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, no continuo sus estudios debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Martha tiene una bodega y se dedica a la venta de menú, inicio vendiendo menú hace ya 8 años, con las ganancias obtenidas puso una pequeña bodega que abandono durante 1 año por problemas económicos y que luego volvió a abrir, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa. Desde hace 3 años también a la venta de zapatos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito de 2000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega y zapatos para campaña escolar.
Martha manifiesta que sueña con comprar una casa en Trujillo y tener una bodega y un restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Nelly M. R. is 37 and lives in the town of Bellavista, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school but didn't continue her studies because she had to dedicate herself to her home. She has two children who still depend on her economically. Martha has a grocery store and sells meals. She started selling meals eight years ago and bought a grocery store with the profits. She stopped running the store for one year because of economic problems but later opened it again. She also sells cereal and potatoes during harvest season. For three years she has sold shoes as well. She has her business in her own home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras," she invested in the purchase of groceries for her store. With this credit of 2,000 soles, which will be canceled in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store and shoes for the school year. Martha tells us that she dreams about buying a house in Trujillo and having a store and a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store and shoes for the school year.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is engaged in vegetable vending in her village of Barangay Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 52 years old and married to Mario, her business partner. The couple was gifted with six children: Ena is 33 years old and a high school graduate; M. is 31 years old and an elementary undergraduate; Florence is 27 years old and a high school graduate; Rizaldy is 24 years old and in the first year of college; Trimar is 18 years old; and the youngest is Jenifer, who is 13 years old and who will be in the first year of high school this coming school year. The couple is working hard to send their children to school and hoping that they will earn college degrees.

Vending is their only source of income. Trinindad and her husband are doing their best to support the immediate needs of their family and the educational needs of their children. She hopes to borrow PHP 8,000.00, which will assist her in her vending business. She hoped that through this loan, her income will increase and her family will have a progressive way of living. In spite of the difficulties she experiences in selling her products, she continues to work hard for the future of her children.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable business

loans.name: Koeuth

texts.en: Mrs. Koeuth K. is 48 years old and married with five children. Most of her children are still minors and under her care. One of her teenage sons works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh City. K. uses a pigpen next to her house to raise pigs for sale. In addition, her husband works as a domestic carpenter. Beside this, the family also cultivates rice for extra income. To make transportation easier for farming work, K. is applying for a loan to buy an ox-cart.

loans.use: To buy an ox-cart

loans.name: Irah Mae

texts.en:
Irah Mae is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Irah Mae is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Irah Mae owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of snacks in the local community. She also retails fruits and vegetables to have extra income.

Irah Mae joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irah Mae is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. Also, she wants to save funds for the schooling of her future children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Отабаева Мавлюда проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Мавлюда более 6 лет занимается пошивкой одежды. Ей в этом помогают две дочки. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена и удобрения для посева. Погашать будет за счет своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mavluda O. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region of Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband is away, working in Russia. Mavluda has been sewing clothes for the last six years. Her two daughters help her in this business. Mavluda is planning to use the loan money to buy seeds and fertilizer for her fields. She will be paying back the loan using profits from her sewing business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Janett María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Janett S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma desde hace cuatro años siendo este el negocio que le ha permitido desarrollarse en conjunto con su familia. Ella vende la ropa en su establecimiento donde los clientes llegan a visitarle a diario.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el propósito de adquirir la ropa para ofertarla. Con el crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Señora Janett S. works at the business of clothing sales and she herself does the selling. For the last four years she, along with her family, have been developing this business. She sells the clothing in her establishment where her customers come to visit her daily. She has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan with the purpose of acquiring clothing to offer for sale. The loan will benefit her greatly and allow her to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Virgen Del Milagro Group

texts.es: Los miembros del Grupo “Virgen del Milagro” se encuentran representadas por la señora Adriana Mabel y conformada por 12 miembros que presentan dos nexos consanguíneos entre las señoras Mirian, Lidia y Maritza, Janeth Claudia que son hermanas con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Un 70% D. los miembros del grupo esta dedicado a la venta D. comida con platos tipicos ya que se encuentran ubicados en una zona turística y el restante 30% se dedica a la elaboración D. masitas y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir.  La competencia en este rubro es bastante exigente ya que los turistas cuentan con paladares bastante exigentes pero los socios cuentan con socias experiencia en su rubro y saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus locales comerciales y la compra D. herramientas e insumos para generar mayores ingresos que les permitirá brindarles a sus familias una  mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias cuentan con un buen historial crediticio, por otro lado vienen demostrando responsabilidad en el pago D. la deuda contraída con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Milagro” Group is represented by Adriana Mabel and consists of 12 members, including two sets of sisters - Mirian and Lidia; and Maritza and Janeth Claduia - who all work totally independent of the other. About 70 percent of the group makes a living selling traditional regional meals in the tourist zone, and the other 30 percent makes a living making little pastries and in dressmaking. The competition in their commercial environment is quite high, since the tourists come with demanding palates, but the members have a lot of experience and know how to keep making headway. The loan they are requesting will be used to expand their places of business and purchase tools and ingredients so they can generate more profits, which will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher quality of life. The members have a strong credit history and also have demonstrated responsibility in repaying debt to our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maureen Nakitto’S Group

texts.en:
Maureen is the leader of her 5-member group. She is a 41-year-old married woman with five children ages 5 to 20. All of her children go to school. Maureen also takes care of additional family members. There are a total of 9 people living in the five roomed house she owns. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Maureen stays in Wakaliga and sells foods like samosas (cow peas) pancakes, mandazi and chqapati’s in two schools - one in Wakaliga and one in the Kampala suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to shop at Owino market, one of the busisest markets in the area. Maureen sells to an average of 50 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works two days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. She has been in this business for the last 5 years.

Maureen has been with MCDT for over six years and servicing her fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. Maureen aspires to see her business grow bigger and to buy a permanent business location.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi sells frozen food in large and small quantities; she has been in business for over ten years. She purchases frozen food from Cotonu, a border town city by Lagos state, and goes to get goods once every week to meet up with customers' demands. Yemisi is 54 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase goods in bulk at a discount. She says thanks!

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 27-year-old man, married and with one child. He lives in Nabatieh (South Lebanon), and he has been repairing cars for ten years. Youssef has been a microcredit client for five years now, and he has always paid on time. His previous loans affected him positively as he gained experience and determination. 

Youssef has faced some difficulties, however, in attracting customers. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase better tools and reimburse his debts. Youssef hopes that with upgraded equipment he will be able to provide better service and so expand his clientele.

loans.use: To purchase tools and reimburse his debts

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn P., 45 years old, is a farmer who has four children. Her eldest child is 24 years old. Though she wanted to send her eldest child to college, their income is not enough to shoulder all the expenses. The tuition is very expensive.

She would like to expand her rice farm. She would like to avail a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her businessto and be able to obtain an abundant harvest for her family.

In April of 2009, she joined in CEVI. Because she likes the policies, she said she will continue to avail CEVI services as she develops her business.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is married with a child and she is 40 years old.She is a happy and hard working woman.She sells clothes and shoes of various colours and sizes.She is happy with this business because she has lots of customers that patronizes her business.she hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is 45 years old. She manage a manage manicure and pedicure business in her  village. She is also beautician in their village and sometimes she is going to other village to earn bigger income for her family needs. Though her business is quite difficult still she is doing her part as bread winner of the family. On her daily routine, she is able to earn PHP350 daily. The income she generate to her business is not enough due to large number of household size. On this regard, she would like to apply a loan amounting PHP8000. She hopes that she could avail the loan amount she is requesting.
	Tessie has been blessed with three children: Daisy Belshane-20 years old; Yorelle Queen-17 years old and Nicole-6 years old who is elementary  pupil. She hopes that she could continue to support her three children.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente du bois de chauffe, des tissus, des savons traditionnels, des condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes, des tubercules  etc. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 185 morceaux de savons traditionnels et une vingtaine de complets en tissus pour hommes et femmes. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, dans les villages avoisinants et au Burkina faso.
Elles vendent dans les différents marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et de façon ambulante, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Kotognogontala are married women averaging 30 years of age and 4 children each living in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in the city of Sikasso (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women of the group are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers and are now on their third group loan.  All the past loans have been repaid.  The women sell firewood, cloth, traditional soaps, condiments, fruit and vegetables, tubers, etc.  With their new loan, they intend to buy a cart-load of firewood, 185 bars of traditional soap, about 20 outfits made of fabrics for men and women.  Supplies are gotten at the big market of Sikasso City, in neighboring villages, and in Burkina Faso.  Sales are made in cash and often on credit to customers composed of men and women at the different markets of Sikasso City, in homes, and by going door-to-door.  The group members each hope to earn an average monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  And the other portion will be invested in businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Joelor

texts.en:
Joelor V. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 41 years old. Joelor is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Joelor owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joelor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Joelor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joelor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joelor is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Joelor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: David

texts.en: Mr. W. David, age 43, has an internet café. He wants to use this loan for adding chairs and improving upon his internet services. He has been operating his business for over 5 years. He hopes to own a large internet café and also a computer training centre so he can create job opportunities for others as well.

loans.use: To add chairs and improve upon his internet services

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa A. is from the town of Camanga,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Generosa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Generosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Martiza's Group

texts.en: Martiza M. is from the town of San Dionicio, MadD., Quirino. She is 51 years old. Martiza is the group leader of a 26-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Martiza M.'s group. Martiza is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Martiza owns and operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Martiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Martiza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the first loan taken out by Martiza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Senicita

texts.en:
Senicita M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Senicita is single and has two adult children. To make a living, Senicita provides video karaoke services to local community members. Senicita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Senicita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Senicita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Senicita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Senicita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es una mujer muy atenta, vive en Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es es madre de tres hijos independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en Essalud (Entidad del estado). Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace 10 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de comida, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 600 soles, que será invertido en la compra de productos de ferretería para venderlos en su bodega. La meta de Rosa es poner una ferretería y mantener su bodega bien implementada con todos los productos que exigen sus cleintes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very considerate woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucalayi region. She is 51 and has three independent children. She runs a convenience store in her house. She has her husband’s support; he works for Essalud (a state entity). Rosa has been part of the Las Dinámicas Communal Bank for ten years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy food. She now needs a loan for 600 PEN, which she will used to buy hardware products to sell in her store. Rosa’s goal is to set up a hardware store and keep her convenience store well stocked with all of the products her customers require.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware products to sell in her convenience store

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en: Noeme Q. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Noeme is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Noeme owns and operates a business known as a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Noeme has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Noeme joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noeme is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Noeme from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old married man with two school-aged children. He is a humble, hardworking man who is employed and also has a business selling clothes. He has been running this business for nine years and uses part of his profits to pay his seven employees. He was previously earning his living by farming.
Richard appreciates Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for giving him a loan to help buy a property. He has now requested a new loan of 70,000 KES to buy clothes to add to his shop's stock. He dreams of owning ten other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for his shop

loans.name: Ana Ethel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado Central, la señora Ana Jarquín tiene su propio tramo de venta de ropa el cuál lo inició desde hace cinco años y hoy en día lo ha ido mejorando gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación en el negocio.

Es madre de un pequeño hijo en edad escolar al que debe de sustentar y brindarle todas las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para invertir en la compra de la ropa para proceder a su respectiva comercialización en su localidad y de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes que le buscan para adquirir la ropa que ella vende.
texts.en:
Ana Ethel J. S. has a store in her house. It is located two blocks to the west of the Edén Club in the Guadalupe neighborhood. She sells clothes, footwear, and toys. She started her business five years ago with C$ 10,000.00 from her parents. Before that she was a student. She opens her business at eight in the morning, and it is open until six in the evening from Monday to Sunday. Mrs. J. S. is a tenacious young woman. She makes sacrifices to get her school age child ahead. She has used her loans to stock her store by purchasing merchandise. She says that she is very grateful to Ceprodel because they have helped get her business ahead. Also, her family has been helped by being able to purchase necessary items for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear for children and adults to stock her business

loans.name: Alleluya Group

texts.fr:
Amani M. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Alleluya ,qui lève la main droite sur la photo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima au 4e cycle, âgée de 41 ans, mère de 8 enfant s dont 6 vont  à l’école et  2 autres sont encore gosses. Son mari est Etudiant à l’université à Goma.
Elle a commencé son petit commerce général de divers  avec son fond propre. Son capital initial était de 80$ appuyé par le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle s’installe régulièrement dans le petit marché du quartier localement  surnommé Trois paillotes - Axe Katindo où elle vend ses produits divers Fanta, farine, savon de lessive Omo, huille , etc. Elle vend également du pétrole à  domicile pour augmenter ses revenus.  
Amani M.  souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et  construire une maison  pour sa famille. 
Elle rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle recoit sans aucune garantie materielle car grace à ces crédits elle parvient  à se payer des unstensils de cuisine et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, et ses enfants étudient confortablement.
Le groupe Alleluya est composé de 15 membres, toutes femmes.
texts.en:
Amani M. is the president of the Alleluya borrowing group, and it is her raising her right hand on the photo. She is a customer of IMF Hekima (4th cycle), 41 years old and mother to eight children, six of whom go to school, the other two being small children still. Her husband is a student at the university in Goma. She began her small diverse business with her own funds. Her initial capital was $80, backed up by a loan from IMF Hekima. She sets herself up in the small market in her neighborhood with the local nickname of "Trois Paillottes - Axe Katindo", where she sells her various products: Fanta, flour, Omo washing powder, oil etc.. She also sells kerosene at home in order to boost her income. Amani M. would like to obtain more loans in order to increase her turnover and build a house for her family. She is grateful to IMF Hekima for the loans she is granted without any material guarantee, since thanks to these loans she is able to pay for kitchen utensils and provide for the needs of her family; her children are able to study comfortably. The Alleluya group is made up of 15 members, all women.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two bags of cassava flour, one bag of sugar, one container of Rina oil, one box of salt, one bag of beans

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es: Visitación tiene 44 años, él comparte su vida con su esposa Catalina y su hijo Andy de 10 años,  ya que sus otros hijos ya son independientes. Hace más de 19 años trabaja en el campo de la construcción, en donde ejerce la labor de albañil, por lo que es contratado por sus servicios para realizar techos, paredes, entre otros. En este trabajo lo ayudan sus obreros para realizar las obras que suelen ser muy pesadas y arriesgadas. Visitación es muy solicitado gracias a su gran experiencia en esta actividad, por tal motivo obtiene buenos trabajos. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y mejorar, es por ello que quiere comprar una máquina para cargar ladrillos, ya que eso lo beneficiaría mucho, ahorrándole tiempo y esfuerzo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una máquina para carga ladrillos, con lo que espera optimizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Visitación is 44 years old and shares his life with his wife Catalina and his ten year old son Andy. Their other children already live independently. Visitación has worked in the construction business for more than 19 years as a mason. He is hired to build roofs, walls, and other structures. In this line of work, he has the assistance of his employees whenever the job involves risk or handling heavy objects. Thanks to his wealth of experience, Visitación receives many requests for his services and is able to secure good jobs. His greatest wish is to succeed and improve. For this reason, he wants to buy a machine for carrying bricks. This will be a great benefit since it will help him save time and effort.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Throughout his time as a member, Visitación has always demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his loan payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy a machine for carrying bricks, which he hopes will make him more efficient in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for carrying bricks

loans.name: Kyandago Development B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Operating a tea plantation has really transformed his life. Having been encouraged by his wife, B. Elikana has been in this tea-selling business for two years which earns him 90,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. Being a married father of five children, he has been able to cater for family problems including paying the school fees for his children.

This loan will enable Elikana to expand his farm through buying more tea seedlings, thus increasing his capacity to supply the factories which are his market. This will enable him to earn more revenue and live a more sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase  more tea seedlings

loans.name: Ermalyn

texts.en:
Ermalyn S. is from the village of District 4. She is 30 years old. Ermalyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ermalyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Ermalyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ermalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ermalyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ermalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn V. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. San Miguel, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and food vending.

Jocelyn’s husband, Roberto, is a laborer. They have six children who are between 9 and 28 years old. Four of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Their other two children are employed.

Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Jocelyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th loan, the amount of PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital. Jocelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: The five people in this group loan are villagers in Spean Daek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha K. is the group leader, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in various ways. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Leng, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to grow crops to earn some money to support their family. But now they have a problem because their field is far away from an irrigation system. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Sokha K. is requesting a loan to buy a pump machine. This couple has six children, all of whom are studying in local public school and help their parents to do farming.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai T. H. is 34 years old and is married with two children who are going to school. She not only grows rice and vegetables but also sells vegetables in the markets. She has operated this business for eight years and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

Hai T. H. has participated in SEDA since 2006. For her last loan, she borrowed 4,578,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to invest in her small business.

About the other client borrowing money with her:

Thao T. P. is 29 years old and has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her small business

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en: Henry S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Brothers. Henry is 26 years old, single and has one child who is two years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 5 years, he has been selling medicated ointment on Mechlin Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 16,250 Liberian Dollars portion of this 81,250 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of medicated ointment. Henry describes himself as a jovial person. His dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of medicated ointment.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y al ultimo de sus hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona productora de frutas para exportación que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Ella suele dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pavos, cuenta con un grupo de estas aves de corral que cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen vivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente cuanta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo donde tiene instalado mango y limón, este último es cosechado semanalmente y luego vendido a las plantas que procesan el fruto para su posterior comercializacion.

Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades ella se encarga de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Josefa trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a los que quiere. Actualmente ella desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales realizando mejoras en sus corrales y comprando alimento balanceado, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Con este préstamo Josefa espera obtener mayores ingresos al momento de vender sus animales. Ella es una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Josefa, 54, lives with her husband and her youngest child in Hualtaco settlement in Tambogrande agricultural district, an area that produces fruit for export and is part of Piura province, Piura region, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has been involved in farming-related activities since she was very young. She tends to raise turkeys for subsequent sale. She has a group of these barnyard fowl that she raises in her back yard. When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that visit the area where she lives. She currently has a small piece of farmland where she grows mango and lemon. The lemons are harvested weekly and sold to the processing plants that process the fruit for commercialization. Income from these activities allows her to help her husband meet family expenses. Josefa tries to give her best effort to stay in business and help her loved ones get ahead. She wants to improve her animal-raising by making some improvements to their enclosures and buying nutritionally balanced feed for them. To reach this goal she has deemed it worthy to request a 700 new sol loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. Josefa hopes that this loan will help her obtain higher income when she sells her animals. She is a tranquil, hard working, responsible woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances trust her and hold her in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced turkey feed and to repair their yards.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Señor Jose Luis es cliente antiguo, se dedica al mantenimiento de elevadores trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana, su actividad es realizada en varios edificios de la ciudad de La Paz, el es bastante reconocido por su clientela ya que es solicitados por muchos clientes por la rapidez y eficiencia en su trabajo, por lo cual tiene un numero significativo de clientes.  El señor Jose Luis invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de repuestos para elevadores por mayor y luego venderos por unidad cuando vaya hacer alguna refaccion, esta muy agradecido por la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José Luis is a longstanding client. He is an elevator maintenance man. He works from very early in the morning in several buildings in La Paz. He is quite well known by his customers and highly sought after because of the speed and efficiency of his work. He, therefore, has a significant number of customers. He will use the funds to buy replacement parts for elevators at wholesale and then sell them at retails when he goes to do some repair. He is very grateful to the Institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for elevators.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus padres, hermanos y sus 2 hijos menores, que estudian en el colegio. Desde hace 6 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica en la venta de comida, gaseosa y dulces, cerca de un paradero de la carretera norte de la ciudad. Con los primeros rayos de luz empieza su labor, pues a las 9 de la mañana la esperan  sus clientes ansiosos por disfrutar de sus platillos, que no solo son muy buscados por su buen sabor, si no también por los precios cómodos que ofrece. Dice que la labor le gusta mucho, además cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y su hijo mayor, para que puedan atender sin problemas a sus clientes. Luego, al mediodía se le acaban sus platillos, y solo se dedica a cobrar porque algunos clientes le pagan semanalmente o diario, dependiendo del trato. Como es una mujer emprendedora, en adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante en algún mercado de su zona pues anhela trabajar de manera estable. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de gaseosa para surtir mejor su negocio, además comprará ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para continuar cocinando y así espera ofrecerles mejor variedad de platillos a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Luz, age 35, lives in her own home with to her parents, brothers and 2 young children who are in school. For 6 years, this enterprising woman has sold food, pop and candy near a bus stop on the highway north of her city. She starts work with the first rays of morning light, and at 9 in the morning she waits for her customers who are anxious to enjoy her dishes. Her food is not only highly sought after for its good flavour, but also for the good prices that she offers. She says that she likes this work a lot, and she counts on the support of her sister and her oldest child so that they can tend to the customers without problems. Later, at noon, she runs out of her dishes, and she works on collecting her money because some of her customers pay her weekly or daily, depending on their deal. Since she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to open a restaurant in a market in her area. She wants to have a stable job. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually since she does not want to look bad in front of the people who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow her to keep working in search of improvement. Luz plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of pop to better stock her business. She will also purchase ingredients wholesale that she needs to continue cooking. This way, she hopes to offer a better variety of dishes to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ingredients wholesale to continue preparing her food.

loans.name: Irma Marlene

texts.es:
Irma tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Vive junto a su hermana en el distrito de Pitipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercializacion de venta de prendas de vestir para damas y niñas, asi como tambien a la venta de  calzado (en su mayoria sandalias); cuenta con aproximadamente un año de experiencia en el rubro, ella se inicio en el trabajo con ayuda de su Tia, la cual actualmente radica en la ciudad de Lima. Esta le envia ropa a precio de costo, para que ella pueda venderla en el distrito de Pitipo y en Ferreñafe.

Irma se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un prestamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería, ya que cuenta con varios pedidos de ropa asi como de calzado. Con esta inversión ella podrá incrementar su variedad de mercaderia, obteniendo asi mayores ingresos por ventas.

Irma esta captando mas clientes en los últimos meses, lo cual hace que su negocio esté creciendo. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales por la zona.
texts.en:
Irma, 20, is single and has no one to support.  She lives with her sister in Pítipo district, Ferreñafe province.  It is located over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells children’s and women’s clothes as well as footwear, mostly sandals.  She has about a year’s experience in this line of work.  She started the business with help from her aunt who is now living in the city of Lima and who sends her low cost clothes that she can resell in Pítipo and in Ferreñafe.

Irma is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She intends to use it to buy more merchandise because she has several pending orders for clothes as well as for footwear.  This investment will allow her to increase variety in her merchandise thus obtaining higher income from her sales.

In the last few months Irma has been securing more customers which cause her business to grow.  She has good personal and work references in the area.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to enlarge the business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean S. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Suol, Barangay Himaya, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing and a fish-vending business. Her husband, Milo S., who is 39 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 5 to 17 years old. 

Mary Jean joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Jean has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her increase her monthly profit to about $355, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP, which she intends to use to do maintenance work on her fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Mary Jean S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is 52 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. To make a living, Cecilia is engaged in the agriculture sector particularly in planting assorted crops to sell. She has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns a monthly net income of 5,000.00 PHP.
 
In 2010, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to redeem the pawned land. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned land.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um T., 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. T. sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 6 each per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of about USD 6.66 per day. 

T. has to spend USD 75 on food, USD 6 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 19 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife H. lives in the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. For the last 12 years, she has made a living as a rice farmer and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a rice farm

loans.name: Ntito  Ene

texts.en:
Ntito has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. She is 32 years old, married to Lokongo Ole K.. They have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Ntito hopes to open a wholesale store for selling skin and hides.

loans.use: To buy five cows to rear and sell at a profit.

loans.name: Abed Elkathem

texts.en:
This borrower, Abed, is 54 years old. He is married and has 5 children.

In 1990, Abed started farming cows which is traditional in his family. He sell a wide variety of dairy products. He has an excellent reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to build a fence for the cattle. He is working on developing his business and increasing his revenue.

loans.use: Build a fence for the cattle

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, age 48, is married and has three children between the ages of 14 and 22. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 20 years. His main products are milk, maize, beans and sorghum, all of which are sold locally. 

He has requested a loan of 61,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva field partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow and start a poultry project. The extra income from this loan will improve his family's livelihood and help him pay school fees for his children. Low market prices for milk and diseases have been his main challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and to start a poultry project.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Andrea Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Andrea Del Socorro se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 6 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de mercancías principalmente desea invertir en los granos básicos, pues vende más al crédito y de contado. La señora posee el sueño de tener un negocio grande en el mercado que brinde mayores ingresos a toda su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Andrea Del Socorro has a small grocery, which she runs out of her house. She has two dependent children. She started her business six years ago selling snacks for children. Little by little she reinvested her profits in her business and started buying basic grains, which are the highest selling products. When she started the business her goal was to find an alternative way to provide for her children; however, her business has helped her improve her life. Now her children have the chance to study. Currently she is applying for a loan to purchase more merchandise, principally basic grains, so that she can sell more both on cash and credit. She dreams of having a large business in the market which would allow her to provide for her entire family.

loans.use: Capital for business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Graciela; La socia es separada,  tiene 7 hijos, tres de ellos aún viven con la socia, ella tiene una tienda abarrotes, la socia tiene la ayuda de sus hijas para atender el negocio, la socia desea implementar su tienda y comprar al por mayor, harina, azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, papa, galletas, fideos y un poco de verduras para surtir el negocio, la socia tiene un dinero ahorrado y más el que requiere podrá comprar la mercadería para trabajar estos meses. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos y de este modo implementar su tienda.

 La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Graciela belongs to the "Mosoq Allpa" community bank in the district of Huanchac, Cusco, Peru. She is divorced and has seven children, three of whom still live with her. Graciela runs a convenience store, and her daughters help her tend to the business. Graciela wishes to set up her shop by buying at wholesale flour, sugar, rice, milk, oil, potatoes, cookies, noodles and a few vegetables to stock her store. She has some money saved and more than she needs to be able to buy merchandise for the next few months. She is requesting the loan to purchase products and in this way set up her store. Graciela is happy that the loan has been authorized and promises to make her payments in the established period.

loans.use: Purchase products to set up her convenience store

loans.name: Phylles

texts.en: Phylles is a 34-year-old business lady who runs a retail shop. She mainly sells cereals and paraffin. She has 5 years of experience in the business. She also has other employment. Therefore, she has employed one person to run her business in her absence. Through Faulu Kenya, she has changed her living standards because of her improved business. She aspires to open a school in the future. She has requested 60,000 KES to buy paraffin and cereals.

loans.use: to buy paraffin and cereals

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 46 years old, married and has four children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and her youngest is 10. She makes a living as a farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, where she has grown rice for the last 30 years. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her goal is to increase the size of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sudamerica Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañia Tuyucua de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Nancy V., ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti, vive con su marido que es empleado y dos hijos estudiantes, la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy responsable y sacrificada, trabaja todos los días con una de sus hijas, quien le ayuda para hacer los tejidos de ñanduti, que semanalmente tiene que entregar. 
La Sra. Nancy trabaja directamente con una persona, quién es la que compra los tejidos de ella y los comercializa en la ciudad de Itagua.
Ella como todas sus compañeras del comité están muy contentas por el apoyo que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para poder seguir invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from Tuyucua in the city of Caacupé.  The group President is Mrs. Nancy V..  She is a ñanduti craftswoman (“ñanduti=spider web; typical Paraguayan lace).  She lives with her husband, who is employed, and her two student children.  

Nancy is a very responsible, dedicated woman.  She works every day with one of her daughters who helps her make the ñanduti lace which she has to deliver weekly.  Nancy works directly with a person who buys her lace and then sells it in the city of Itagua.  Like all her fellow members, she is happy for the support Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva provides to continue investing in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, handlooms, needles and notions.

loans.name: Sith

texts.en:
Sith B. is 31-year-old man who operates a motorcycle taxi to earn a profit. He also sells ice cream in and around his community of Ang Snoul. Sith B. earns a daily income of around $4.33 to use for the family’s needs. His wife is employed as a garment factory worker, where she earns a monthly salary. The couple is blessed with two school-aged children.

Presently, Sith B.’s income is low because his motorcycle is too small to carry many passengers. He has decided to ask for a loan of $1,100 to buy a new motorbike (tuk tuk) which can pick up more passengers than before.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school.

To earn a living, Mary sells fish. She is seeking a loan to stock more fish that she could then sell to her customers. She hopes to construct a building for her business in the future with any additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio, 43 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. Eugenio is engaged in raising hogs. When he sells one hog, his net income is 3,000 PHP every three months. He's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed for his hogs. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support him in the future as he looks to expand his business and eventually start his own new store.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina de 61 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia que cuenta con servicio de agua y luz y esta ubicada en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad,  esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  Miguelina tiene hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 

Miguelina se dedica  a la venta de frutas en el mercado de San Pedro de Lloc, tiene una experiencia de 10 años y es muy conocida en la zona. Cuenta con clientela fidelizada y las ventas de sus productos han incrementado; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El préstamo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles, este lo utilizará en la compra de frutas para abastecer a su clientela. El aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  

Miguelina es una persona con muchas aspiraciones y una de ellas es  tener un puesto más grande en el mercado para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas, ganar más clientes, obtener mayores ingresos y tener las comodidades que tanto desea en su casa.
texts.en:
Miguelina is 61 years old. She lives with her husband in their own home, which receives water and electricity services. Miguelina resides in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This area is known primarily for its agriculture and livestock businesses. Miguelina has grown children who are independent.

She sells fruit at the market in San Pedro de Lloc. Miguelina has 10 years of experience and is well-known in the area. She has a loyal customer base and the sales of her products have grown. Her earnings have helped to improve her quality of life.

The loan she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa represents seed capital in the amount of 2000 PEN. This money will be used to buy fruit that she can sell to her customers. By increasing her sales, she will be able to cover her loan payments and meet her household obligations.

Miguelina is a person who has many aspirations. One of them is to have a larger vending post at the market so that she can offer a wider variety of fruits, attract more customers, and obtain more income. As a result, she can acquire the comforts that she wants to have in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Nelson Adrian

texts.es:
La chatarra y los productos reciclables son los insumos para el negocio de Nelson Adrian, quien desde hace algún tiempo decidió recibirlos y transformarlos para la venta y así obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, este emprendedor inició su negocio hace algunos años en el municipio de Concordia de donde es oriundo pero con el propósito de abrir su mercado y mejorar su calidad de vida decidió mudarse para Santa Bárbara también al norte de Antioquia donde actualmente tienen su negocio. 
 
Nelson Adrian necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina para cortar el hierro, un soldador para abrochar su conocimiento y elaborar piezas metálicas, así como para comprar algunos productos reciclables.
texts.en:
Scrap and recyclable materials are the supplies for the business of Nelson Adrian, who some time ago decided to receive these things and transform them for sale.  In this way he gets the income he needs to cover his basic requirements.  This entrepreneur started his business a few years ago in the municipality of his native Concord, but in order to expand his market and improve his quality of life he decided to relocate to Santa Barbara, also in northern Antioquia, which is where he currently has his business.

Nelson Adrian needs a loan to buy a machine for cutting iron, a soldering iron for fastening and preparation of metal parts according to his knowledge, as well as to buy some recyclable materials.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Juboo du Banc Villageois de Baralé Ndiaye est créé le 17 mai 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village,une bonne entente règne entre elles d'où le nom donné de JUBOO.La principale activité menée est le petit commerce.


Madame Dialle la responsable est âgée de 58 ans, mariée elle a dix neuf personnes en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de chaussures,elle a une bonne expérience de 5 ans; elle est debout à droite sur la photo couverte d'un châle blanc.


Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes ou bien fait confectionner les chaussures par ses grands frères et les revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de gagner plus de revenus et aussi satisfaire la clientèle.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices obtenus augmenter son épargne pour obtenir un crédit élevé et élargir son champ d'action; mais aussi de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Juboo solidarity group of the Baralé Ndiaye Village Loan Fund was created on 17 May 2010; it comprises fifteen women who live in the same village and have good relationships with each other, which is the source of the name Juboo. The main group activity is small retail business.

Ms. Dialle, the group leader, is 58 years old, married, and has nineteen people in her care. She runs a business selling shoes, and has gained solid experience over 5 years. She is standing on the right in the photo, wearing the white shawl.

She gets her supplies of shoes in the cities or has her elder brothers make them, and then re-sells them at the weekly markets. 

With her loan, she hopes to strengthen her business in order to earn more income and also satisfy her customers.

With her profits, she intends to increase her savings in order to obtain a larger loan and expand her market, as well as support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maricel has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & candies.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as Sadie, cheese and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en: Sochea, 34 years old, is a farmer and animal seller. His wife is a garment factory worker.  Their income is $5 per day.  He has four children, all of whom are studying.  Every month, he has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy food for feeding pigs, and fertilizer for his farm.  In the future, he wants to raise more pigs at home so that he can have enough money to send all of his children to finish high school at least.

loans.use: To buy food for feeding pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
The person covered in this page is Rosalie. She is 28 years old and married. In Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, she peddles food items around nearby communities or within the community itself to earn a living. She is named as one of the courteous food vendors in the area in which she has worked for 2 years. Every month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Rosalie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP at GDMPC to buy food supplies for a vending job. She was registered as a member in the cooperative earlier this year. Getting involved in this borrowing activity is a way that she can sustain her work and continue what she is doing today. She aims to own an ordinary food stand in the area and sell the best saleable items.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for a vending job.

loans.name: Klever Alexander

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive don Klever, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 12 años de edad  los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. La mujer se dedica al hogar.
 
Nuestro amigo para llevar el pan diario a su casa se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta que el todos los días desde la madrugada se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta para abastecerse de productos en el mercado de mayorista, luego  se dedica a sus ventas por toda la ciudad la misma que recorre en un triciclo de su propiedad, el tiene definidas las zonas por  donde vende y tiene muchos clientes. Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Este es su segundo  ciclo en el banco comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que dan los créditos y sin tantos papeleos.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para hacer sus ventas.
texts.en:
The December 24th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts have received national and international recognition. The famous Panama hats are made in this place.
