Don Klever lives in this area. He is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 13 and 12) who are studying at a high school and elementary school respectively. His wife is a homemaker.

Klever earns his daily household income by selling fruits and legumes. He says that every day at dawn he travels to the city of Manta to stock up on produce at the wholesale market. Klever then makes his sales by roaming around the city using a tricycle that he owns. He has defined areas where he sells and attracts many customers. Klever has been in business for seven years and is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and legumes. He is in his second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and likes the speed in which the loans are issued with very little paperwork. His dream is to buy a car that he can use to make his sales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and legumes.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married and has one child. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Esha has operated a restaurant, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from restaurant operators in the area.  Esha dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Esha is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: José Andres

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo.

Él trabaja en la agricultura desde hace ocho años, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en sembrar maíz, fríjol y en la crianza de vacas.  Todos sus cultivos los maneja él solo y nunca ha tenido problemas de perdida.

Se levanta todos los días a las 4:30 de la mañana para alimentar a sus animales y luego los lleva a pastorear a un cerro caminando una hora y media para llegar donde tiene sus cultivos. Para aprovechar su viaje al cultivo el cliente necesita tener vacas, así en lo que él trabaja en el cultivo los animales podrán alimentarse y obtener buena producción de leche, de esta manera mejorara la producción de leche, lo cual le permitirá mejorar la canasta básica de su hogar.

Don José adquiere sus insumos en una ciudad del oriente del país, por lo que debe viajar durante una hora, además debe pagar por el trasporte, pero él se siente muy satisfecho de lo que hace.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una vaca la cual le dará leche y queso, de esta forma alimentara a su familia, ahorrándose la compra de estos en otra parte y puede obtener un mejor ingreso.

Don José desea tener varias vacas, cultivar más maíz y poder construir su casa de ladrillo, por que la que tiene es de bloque y darle la oportunidad a su hijo de tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He lives with his life partner and their son.

He's been a farmer for eight years and has a lot of experience growing beans and corn and raising cows. He tends all his crops on his own and has always had good success.

He gets up at 4:30 in the morning every day to feed his animals and then walks them to pasture on a hill about an hour and a half away, where his crops are. To take advantage of the trip, he needs cows, so that he'll be able to feed the animals what he grows and they'll produce a lot of milk. That way he will produce more milk, which will improve his family's economic situation.

Don José gets his supplies in a city in the eastern part of the country. It takes him an hour to get there and he has to pay for the bus ticket, but he's very happy with his work.

He's requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a cow so he can produce milk and cheese to feed his family. That way he can save money and earn a better income.

Don José would like to have several cows, grow more corn, and be able to build a brick house--the one he has now is made of cinder blocks--so he can offer his son the opportunity to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 7 mujeres quienes son responsables, trabajadoras, carismáticas y alegres, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, tiene un hermoso centro histórico el cual revela la historia de la ciudad, la cultura y tradiciones. Su gente es muy cálida y amable, como nuestras socias quienes luchan día a día para mejorar su situación económica para salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Ana, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños (Cuenca). Tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido un bebé de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios para recorridos turísticos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a la cría y venta de animales  como cerdos y cuyes, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 3 años, trabaja solo los días de feria y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su hijo y a su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 5 años y sus créditos los ha invertido en el incremento de su negocio, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y cuyes para seguir creciendo en esta labor.
 
Su meta es criar pollos para comenzar con este negocio.

Las fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevas Amigas consists of 7 women who are responsible, hardworking, charismatic and happy women. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city has been a cultural heritage site since 1999. It has a beautiful historical city centre which tells of the city's history, culture and traditions. The people are very warm and friendly, as are our members who struggle daily to improve their economic situation and take care of their families.

One of the members of this group is Señora Ana. She lives in a community that belongs to the parish of Baños (Cuenca). She is 25 years old, married and has an 8 month old baby. Her husband is a driver by profession and works offering his services for sightseeing tours. They do not own their own house and so rent.

Doña Ana breeds and sells animals such as pigs and guinea pigs. She has been doing this work for the last 3 years. She works only on weekdays and spends the rest of the time taking care of her child and home.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and has invested her loans in growing her business. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of pigs and guinea pigs to continue growing the business.

Her goal is to raise chickens to start in this business.

The small photos are of 3 members who for work reasons could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old and married with one child. Delia works very hard to provide for the family.

Delia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, cream, soap, oil, and spices. 

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María de 25 años, empezó con el negocio de la tienda hace 5 años atrás vendiendo mercadería en una tienda que está ubicada en su casa y su esposo trabaja como taxista todos los días.

María trabaja en su tienda de lunes a domingos de 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. El único problema que presenta su trabajo es la delincuencia y la inestabilidad de la energía eléctrica.

Tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal y una niña de 10 meses de nacida.

Su meta a alcanzar es agrandar mas el negocia para así generar un poco mas de ingresos para poder darle la educación a sus hijos y que su familia cuenta con una buena salud.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old. She started her store 5 years ago selling merchandise from a store that is located in her house. Her husband works every day as a taxi driver.

Maria works in her store Mondays to Sundays from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. The only problem with her work is the crime and unreliability of the electrical supply.

She has 2 children who study at a state school and a girl who is 10 months old.

Her goal is to be able to enlarge her business so as to generate a little more income and so be able to provide her children with an education. She also wants her family be healthy.

loans.use: to buy tuna, colas, and other products.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a man with courage and dedication for his work. Rolando, 42-years-old, is married with three grown children. He engages in the farm business where he plants a crops like corn. Their village is well known as an agriculture area.

Rolando is asking for a loan of P 35,000 to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm. Rolando hopes that someday he can see all his children finish their studies and also he can provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es: Desiderio de 29 años de edad convive con fortunita de 32 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada, en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia.  Para Desiderio en esta vida nada es imposible, ya que a pesar de que estuvo económicamente decaído, sacó a relucir su entusiasmo y fuerza para salir adelante. Él siempre  estuvo pendiente de su trabajo, por lo que para él “siempre hay algo que hacer” y eso lo convierte en una persona perseverante y digna de imitar. Aparte de tener su cultivo de cacao y café, también trabaja para otras personas como obrero en el campo, cuando está desocupado de su trabajo. De esa manera tiene un ingreso extra para su familia. Generalmente trabaja de manera independiente, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, y la de sus peones en tiempos de cosecha para que lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de sus productos. Normalmente su producto los vende en su misma localidad a precio de mercado y sus ventas vienen mejorando de manera consecutiva. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su sembrio de café en un terreno virgen, con el propósito de cosechar mayores volúmenes de granos de café. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.  Con los 2,000 comprara más fertilizantes para aplicar a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Desiderio is 29 years old and lives with 32 year old Fortunita.  They have four children.  This family lives in a home of their own, located in Monterrico, within the Sivia district.  For Desiderio, nothing in life is impossible.  Despite the fact that he was financially broke, he renewed his enthusiasm and strength to get ahead.  He was always attentive to his work, because for him “There is always something to do,” and that makes him a person of perseverance and dignity to be emulated.

Besides having his crop of cacao and coffee, he also works as a farm laborer for others, whenever he doesn’t have work to do in his own fields.  In this way he has an extra income for his family.  He generally works independently, but sometimes his family helps him.  He also gets help from his field hands during harvest season.  He sells his products in the same area, at market prices, and his sales are improving consecutively.  His plans for the future are to expand his coffee plantings on a piece of virgin land, in order to harvest larger quantities of coffee beans.  This will be his second loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 2,000 PEN ($750) to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 40 years old, a married woman with seven children. Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Edina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts, maize, and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, maize, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah, aged 52, is married to Fredrick and they are blessed with three children. Rodah has operated a retail shop for six years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 15,600.

This is Rodah's third loan with KADET and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and soda for sale. Rodah intends to use the anticipated profits from this loan to pay school fees. She hopes to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and soda

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 44 years old, married to Benson and they are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past eighteen years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing which will help her diversify her income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Jesutin1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTIN1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elisabeth est âgée de 58 ans et vit au Bénin. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté. Elisabeth est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à sa charge. Elisabeth vit seule avec ses deux enfants qui restent à sa charge et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer ses diverses charges, Elisabeth vend depuis trois ans, divers produits et des charbons de bois à son domicile. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTIN1, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les six premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUTIN1 Group is made up of three women who are friends. For the seventh time, the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Elisabeth, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 58 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's a widow and the mother of four children, out of whom some attend school. She still has to support two of them.

Elisabeth lives alone with the two children who are in her care, and provides for herself and them on her own. In order to ensure that her various expenses are covered, she's been selling various products and charcoal at her home for three years. 

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's cities. Eager to meet customer demand, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Elisabeth, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her seventh loan from ALIDé. The first six loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy various food products and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Agricultural business has been the main primary source of income of Zenaida's family. She is 40 years old and happily married.The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children who goes to school.

Zenaida have been operating her two hectares of rice field for almost 20 years.She would like to develop her agricultural business so that she could gain more income.Due to shortage of capital,Zenaida would like to borrow loan amount of P50,000 which will be use in buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of raised crops. This loan amount will really help her to earn for greater profit to be able to ensure sustainable future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farming business

loans.name: Ruthsel

texts.en:
Ruthsel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has  4 children. 

Ruthsel has a shop that sells NATASHA & AVON products like clothing & cosmetics. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products to sell.

Ruthsel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ruthsel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquieme prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et riz  avec   NAGNOUMA , 1ère personne debout de la  droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KANGARE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Essenam est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé et qui a deux enfants à charge. Agée de 31 ans, Essenam est une revendeuse des mèches, des articles de mercerie et des pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Essenam désire ce prêt pour acheter des douzaines de mèches et des rouleaux de doublures en vue d’en tirer un maximum de profit et d’amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter 06 douzaines de mèches et 10 rouleaux de doublures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelius would like to invest in the stock exchange mrket.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Roma minority in Sliven, Bulgaria.

Diana is a traveling sock saleswoman. She purchases inventory from five large producers based in Sliven and spends four days per week traveling to several regional, open-air markets. Her “sales territory” extends east to the Black Sea, south to the Turkish border, and west to Stara Zagora, in the center of Bulgaria. Diana charters a minivan with five other Sliven-based traveling merchants, who sell shoes, tracksuits and other apparel.

The unit economics of Diana’s business are fairly straightforward. She purchases socks for the local equivalent of $0.20-$0.30 and sells them at 2x – 3x their cost. Diana sells between 300 and 400 of pairs per month, with a gross profit of approximately $200. After paying out her share of the minivan, she nets around $150.

Diana has requested this loan for two reasons. First, she is looking to expand the breadth of her inventory. Right now, she only has money to carry some of the more basic sock styles, and believes she could sell more if she had a broader inventory. Second, Diana wants to purchase an overhead sign for her booth in order to attract more attention and develop a brand, as well as provide cover for her products when it rains. Currently, she covers her socks with plastic during inclement weather, but realizes that potential clients purchase more when they can easily browse merchandise; a plastic covering prevents that.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy T. N. is the 37 year-old mother of three children who are in school. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery stand at her house and typically makes around $2.50/day, while her husband makes an average of about $7/day in revenue from selling cabinets at the nearby market. Mrs. T. N. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory to satisfy her clients' needs. The rest of the loan she will use to repair her house which normally leaks during the rainy season. In the future, Mrs. T. N. wants her current stand to become a big store with many kinds of products that meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: Mrs. Tek nim would like to purchase some grocery products for her inventory and to repair her house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.name: Kriya

texts.en:
Kriya is married in 1978 and has 5 children, 4 daughters and 1 son. He started his transportation service since the early of 2006. He has been trained to repair the fishing net and boat machine. His wife with four daughters is employed to embroidering cloths for commission fee at home. Cloths are collected from the factory.

He has already borrowed loan from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount he asked is $600. He will use this given loan to purchase a motorbike in order to use as a transportation service to meet customers who want to use his transportation services and collect cloths from nearby factory to embroider at home. He is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Purchasing one motorbike.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma J. is 45 years old and is married to 47-year-old Ramon Ruiz. They have five children; four have moved away from home and one attends high school. In 1995, Irma started a small grocery store with her husband's help. He had to immigrate to Argentina to work and save enough capital to get started.

After 3 years, don Ramon returned home and they started their small business. At first they only sold staples, such as yerba mate, rice, sugar, soap and cooking oil. Later, as they were able to reinvest their earnings, they added a small dining room where they serve fast foods and even have catered events on their large patio on Saturdays. Thanks to these activities they have been able to finance their children's studies and live with a measure of dignity.

This loan will be used to purchase rice, sugar, meats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma J. tiene 45 años de edad, está casada con Ramón Ruiz, de 47 años, tienen cinco hijos; uno de sus hijos está en la secundaria y cuatro restantes ya viven en casa diferentes. Irma empezó a montar una despensita en el año 1995 con la ayuda de su marido, quien tuvo que emigrar a la Argentina para poder trabajar y conseguir un capital inicial. Luego de tres años el Señor Ramón volvió a su país y comenzaron con el negocio, en principio en la despensita vendían productos varios, tales como, yerba mate, arroz, azúcar, jabón, aceite, entre otros, ya con un capital adquirido del propio negocio empezaron a montar un pequeño comedor de comidas rápidas e incluso realizaban eventos los días sábados, ya que tenían un patio amplio, gracias a esta actividad está pudiendo solventar los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y llevar una vida digna. El crédito lo utilizará en la compra de azúcar, arroz, carne, etc.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, meats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on her stock.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang K., age 49, is widow who works at a garment factory, earning about $4 each day. She has three children who are employed at a garment factory as well. She also takes care of her mother who lives with her. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation. This will make it easier for her and her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.name: Simah

texts.en: Simah, 47, has a vegetables stall at her house. She can earn up to USD 10 a day, while her husband, P., is a driver who earns about USD60 a month. She is asking for a loan of USD150 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Njeru A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret M.. She is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan to add to her shoe business. Margret is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 5 children ranging from age 12 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to higher institutions of learning. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more stock to increase profits and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Sauda Z., Florence W., Florence K., and Alice T.. Sauda Z. has a business in spare parts sales and wants to add more capital to the business. Florence W. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to build and expand her restaurant. Florence K. operates a retail shop business and wants to expand to a wholesale business. Alice T. is currently in the business of poultry raising and is requesting a loan to order new chicks and buy poultry feeds.

loans.use: To expand and boost shoe business

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en: Saadat was born in 1976. She lives in Khachmaz town, and has 2 children. Four years ago, she started a tailoring business. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth for tailoring business

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is the thirty-four year old married father of a three year old son. His wife is a hairdresser. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Korea and Canada. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Evans hopes that he is able to increase his sales volume and can set aside more money to prepare for his sonr’s school fees. Evans is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Evans would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths, bedspreads and housewares to move a small business forward.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce cakes, ice cream and sweets.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou Sané, age 51, is married and the mother of 2 school-attending children that she has to support. She's been a member of the Alwar village bank for 7 years. To bolster her business, she wants to buy pieces of sheet metal, cement and paint to renovate her luncheonette. She also wants to buy tableware and food products (beef, black-eyed pea, sugar, condensed milk and spaghetti) to prepare meals to sell (breakfast, soup and dinner). Her revenues enable her to provide for her family. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Bintou Sané âgée de 51 est mariée avec 02 enfants qui vont à l’école à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Alwar depuis 7 ans. Pour renforcer son activité elle veut acheter des tôles, du ciment, de la peinture pour réfectionner sa gargote et acheter aussi de la vaisselle et des denrées (pattes de bœuf, niébé, sucre, lait concentré et pâtes spaghetti) pour la préparation des repas à vendre (petit déjeuner,soupe et diner). Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To renovate her luncheonette and to buy food products

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 31 años, vive solo con sus dos hijos. Cada día trabaja en las diversas tareas del campo, cultiva papa, cereales, cebolla y alfalfa, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, al engorde de animales para luego venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Huancayo, estas actividades le toma varias horas, todos los días sin excepción,  ya que se asegura de conseguir lo necesario para los gastos de su casa, se levanta muy temprano para cortar el pasto y darle alimento a sus animales, seguido de eso vela por el bienestar de sus campos de cultivo. Para la venta de su ganado, viaja cada tres meses para las diferentes ferias en las ciudades aledañas a su localidad.
Rocío se esfuerza para sostener a sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar.
Solicita este préstamo con el que adquirirá un torete flaco, lo hará engordar para luego venderlo en la feria ganadera.
texts.en:
Rocío is 31 years old and lives by herself with her two children. Every day, she works in the diverse tasks of the field: cultivating potato, grain, onion and alfalfa crops. She also raises farm animals, fattening them to later sell in the cattle fairs of Huancayo. She works odd hours every day of the week without exception, since she has to be assured of earning what she needs for household expenses. She gets up very early to feed the animals and allow them to graze, after which she looks after her crops. To sell her livestock, she travels every three months to different fairs in neighboring cities. Rocío strives to maintain her two school-age children. She is asking for this loan to purchase a small bull, which she will fatten and later sell at a cattle fair.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small bull to fatten and later sell at a cattle fair.

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en:
Tafaoga F., 26, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the general public and villagers seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 560 Tala (~233 USD).  

SPBD loans are Tafaoga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She runs a very small shop in her community. With the first loan she borrowed, she was able to start up her business and she has successfully paid off this loan. 

She is now requesting her next loan to purchase a fridge and shelves for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase purcahse a fridge for drinks and shelving display cabinets

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla N. is a 44-year-old trader who sells different kind of goods in his shop, which is located in a city in southern Azerbaijan. 

Abdulla started his business in 1999 when poverty knocked at his door. Step by step, he developed his business and now he rents a place that he uses for his shop. However, his main wish is to build his own shop and expand his business. He has already saved some money for building, but to start the building process, he needs additional funds. Also, because this business is the only financial source in Abdulla's family, he also would like to expand number of goods he sells. 

To fulfill all his goals, Abdulla has applied for a loan of $1200. Your contribution can make his wishes come true!

loans.use: To build a shop and buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Léonie

texts.en:
Léonie Z. was born on April 11, 1973 and has 2 children. She is a seamstress by training but she opted to start a business instead. She started selling food 5 years ago in a cafeteria, but after its closing, she began selling holistic pharmaceutical products. However, she went in search of a more profitable product and sold children's underwear. Léonie used her creative side to meld her underaear business with selling boiled corn (a traditional Beninese food). With her second loan, she could like to buy more tunics to make underwear and wheat flour to make her corn snack.

Dame Z. Léonie est née le 11/04/1973, et est couturière de formation mais elle a opté pour le commerce. En effet, il y a 05 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans la vente de nourriture dans une buvette mais après la ferméture de celle-ci, elle a commencé par vendre des produits pharmaceutiques traditionnelles. Mais cette activité ne lui a pas été rentable et elle l'abandonna au profit de la vente de sous vêtements des enfants. A la recherche d'un mieux-être, dame Z. ne manque pas d'imagination; sa dernière trouvaille est la vente de pagne et de bouillie à base de maïs.C'est pour renforcer cette activité qu'elle sollicite ce 2eme prêt pour l'approvisionnement en pagne, en maïs et farine de blé . Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le dernier prêt a servi à l'approvisionnement en pagne, en farine de blé et en huile végétale.

loans.use: 10 half swatches of hitarget fabric, half bag of wheat flour, oil drum, a bag of corn, half bag of powdered sugar

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
Elba Rosa D. es una dama muy esforzada que con gran esfuerzo se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual ha logrado ir mejorando poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido.

El desarrollo del negocio se lo debe a Ceprodel ya que le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de la ropa para abastecer sus estantes. Hoy en día con el compromiso de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación ha decido una vez mas acudir a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de la ropa y así continuar con el negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Elba Rosa D. is a very determined woman who has dedicated herself with much effort to her business of clothing sales. She has managed to improve it little by little as time has passed. She owes the development of the business to Ceprodel since she has benefited from credits that she has used to purchase clothing to stock her shelves. Today with the obligation she has of bringing home an income, she has decided once more to turn to Ceprodel to obtain a credit to purchase clothing and continue with her business that needs her support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Bassam has been working as a taxi driver for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his taxi. This is the first time that Bassam has requested a loan. His clients can be anybody. In the future, he plans to purchase a new car.

loans.use: Bassam will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo 
Ana es casada, tiene 43 años, dos hijos de 23 y 19 años estudiantes de instituto superior.
Empezó trabajando en un salón de belleza, hasta que se caso se dedicó a su casa e hijos hasta que crecieron. Con su hermano a medias pusieron una boutique, ella aprendió del negocio y ahora tiene  su  tienda de venta ropa se llama  “ANITA”,  ella trae ropa de gamarra y ropa importada del sur del país. Trabaja de lunes a domingo, su hijo le ayuda con la contabilidad cada fin del mes.    
Desde que esta en Finca puede invertir más, aprende de las otras socias, comparten experiencias que enriquecen su negocio y vida.   
Ana necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para invertirlo en la compra de ropa escolar, pantalones, blusas, polos. 
El sueño de ana es tener una tienda propia, la que tiene es alquilada.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Ana is married. She is 43 years old and has two children, aged 23 and 19 who attend institutions of higher learning. She worked in a beauty salon until she married, at which time she became a homemaker and cared for her children until they were older. She and her brother co-owned a boutique where she learned the business. Today she has her own clothing store called "ANITA". She brings in clothing from the Gamarra shopping mall as well as clothing imported from the South of the country. She works from Monday to Sunday. Her son helps her with the accounting at the end of each month. Since joining Finca she has been able to invest more, she is learning from the other members who share experiences which enrich her business and her life. Ana needs a 1,200 soles loan to invest in clothing for school, pants, blouses, polo shirts. Ana's dream is to own her own locale: the one she has now is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for school, pants, blouses, polo shirts for retail

loans.name: Sefau

texts.en:
Sefau K., 81, is married with nine children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166).

SPBD loans are Sefau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy farming equipment while her husband does the work with the help of two sons.

loans.use: Purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Moen

texts.en:
Mrs. Moen N. is a villager in Check village in the Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kum Choeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to purchase gasoline and pesticides. Thus, Mrs. Moen N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and for hiring laborers to work in the field.

She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 50 years old and the mother of six children: one is a farmer, two are laborers and the remaining three are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides and hire laborers

loans.name: Sioana

texts.en: Sioana M., 32, is married with two children. She has four years of experience in her barbeque business. She sells to the public four days per week. She has no previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 125 Tala (approximately 45 USD). SPBD loans are Sioana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a box of lamb flaps, chicken , sausages, and other things necessary for her barbeque business

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз Шарипов мужчина 43 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Азиз закончив среднюю школы , поступил в высшее учебное заведение и окончил по специальности инженера.Сейчас по специальности работает на заводе главным инженером по сборке оборудований.Кроме своей работы он занимается производством цементных кирпичей.У него своя мини фабрика на которой работают два ученика.Азиз хочет получив кредит закупить оптом цемент и битый песок.И использовать для производства продукции в сезон.Азиза жена работает учительницей в средней школе, её заработная плата очень низкая и не хватает для обеспечения хотя бы одеждой своих детей.Поэтому у Азиза много расходов на семью.
texts.en:
Aziz S. is a 43-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Aziz graduated from high school, and went on to complete his higher education and graduate in engineering. Now he works as the chief engineer at an equipment assembly plant. In addition to this job, he manufactures cement blocks. He has his own mini-factory and employs two apprentices. Aziz would like to take out a loan to purchase cement and aggregate wholesale, and use it for the manufacture of seasonal products. Aziz's wife works as a secondary school teacher, but her salary is low, insufficient even for buying clothes for their children, therefore Aziz has many family expenses.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brick manufacturing

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina M. operates a food-vending business at her age of 60 years old and is married to Remigio. They are blessed with five children: Junior is 38 years old and a farmer; Remilyn is 35 years old and an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker); Rubelyn is 32 years old and an entrepreneur; Rosemarie is 28 years old and a housewife; and their youngest is Mary-Ann who is 21 years old. According to Adelina, in their small rural town of La Paz all of the villagers have a strong sense of community and help each other out.

For almost 27 years now, Adelina has had a business selling vegetables and prepared food. Aside from that, she also manages a typical village store just beside her food stand. She hopes to a loan of  PHP 8,000 in order to increase her current weekly business net income of PHP 1,500. She is really giving her best in order to develop her business despite her old age.

loans.use: To increase her current weekly net income

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama T. est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui  vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou  de la ville de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après les études secondaires, Madame Adama T. est restée très longtemps sans emploi. Elle  se lança dans les activités génératrices de revenus mais sans succès. Elle décida ainsi d’apprendre le commerce d’articles divers auprès de sa sœur jumelle. Par finir, elle se spécialisa dans la vente de pagnes wax  et  de mèches pour la coiffure. Avec une expérience de 7 ans Adama T. maîtrise cette activité et est très sollicitée.
Pour améliorer son activité en diversifiant ses articles, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter des pagnes wax et des mèches de différentes sortes  à Lomé et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes.  Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit  dans le quartier et dans les structures aux salariés de la place. Avec une clientèle essentiellement  constituée de femmes,  sa période propice de vente est surtout les fêtes religieuses et les événements sociaux.
Avec ce prêt, Madame Adama T. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui servira à agrandir son activité et ouvrir une boutique au grand marché de Bougouni.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama T. is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After secondary school, she remained without employment for a long time. She got started in income-generating work but unsuccessfully. She therefore decided to learn about commerce in various goods with the help of her twin sister. In the end, she became specialized in selling Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and hair extensions for hairdressing. With seven years of experience, Adama has a command of this business and is in high demand. To improve her business through diversifying her merchandise, she decided to collaborate with avec Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy Wax pagnes and hair extensions of different sorts in Lomé and in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. Her merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the area and in local organizations to salaried workers. She has a customer bases composed essentially of women, and her favorable instances for making sales are especially during religious holidays and societal events. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand her business and to open a shop at the grand marketplace of Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, tiene estudios de educación primaria completa y vive en el  Barrio Santa Rosa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  recibió un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para su negocio de compra y productos de la región como chuño, papa, oca, quinua, etc. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio.  Con este dinero comprará chuño, papas y otros productos de la región.
Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse un carro. A ella le gusta los ahorros, y las charlas que recibe del personal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
The señora Gregoria belongs to the Communal Bank 'Señor de Los Milagros', which is located in the community of Imicati, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, is married, has 7 children, has completed primary school and lives in the neighbourhood of Santa Rosa. Gregoria has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years. She received an initial loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase products for her business such as potato flour, potatoes, geese, quinoa, etc. In this moment Gregoria needs a loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, to be able to invest in her business. With this money she will buy potato flour, potatoes, and other products of the region. Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a car. She likes the savings and the personal conversations that she has with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato flour, potato, geese, quinoa etc

loans.name: Harouna

texts.fr:
Monsieur Harouna Konaté est âgé de 34 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses enfants  dans le quartier Niébala de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales (pauvreté des parents) Harouna abandonne l’école à l’âge de 12 ans. Étant l’ainé de sa famille, il décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus pour aider son père à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur auprès d’un de ses  ami. Avec une expérience de 15 ans, il a une maîtrise de son activité, et jouit d’une très grande popularité au niveau de la ville de Bougouni.
Dans le souci de satisfaire et fidéliser sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter une machine à broderie à Bamako (capitale du Mali)
Il est à son premier prêt individuel  avec l’institution. Sa clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage améliorer son atelier pour  avoir davantage de clients et  contribuer aux dépenses de la famille tout en aidant son père.
texts.en:
Mr. Harouna Konaté, age 34, lives with his wife and children in the Niébala neigborhood of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Because of his parents' poverty, Harouna left school at the age of 12. As the eldest child, he decided to undertake income-generating activity to help his father support the family. After several unsuccessful ventures, he chose to learn the tailor's trade from a friend.

Fifteen years later, he has mastered his art, and enjoys great popularity with men and women clients in the city of Bougouni.

In order to satisfy and keep his growing clientele, Harouna is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to purchase an embroidery machine in Bamako, the capital of Mali. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He expects to realise a monthly income benefit of 60 000 FCFA, which he will use to improve his workshop to accomodate more clients, as well as help his father by contributing to paying the family expenses.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an Embroidery machine

loans.name: Analin

texts.en:
ANALIN A. is 40 years old, single and resides at Prk. Proper South, Brgy. Taloc in the City of Bago, Negros Occidental.

Being single does not mean that Analin is without dependents or family responsibilities. This is why she has always aimed for financial independence for herself. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, and she started a "sari-sari" or general store, her target was to have a successful business within 2 years - and she achieved this by sheer industriousness.

After two years, she expanded her product offerings from just what her neighbors would need like groceries, baked goodies and the usual grocery and dry goods, to fertilizers and other agricultural needs that farms in the area might require. Now she even sells frozen dressed chicken, school supplies and a variety of other stuff that one might not even find in a local supermarket.

For her 18th loan cycle, Analin wants to borrow PHP 29,500.00 to add to her working capital so that she could buy more stocks for her store and offer an ever wider variety of goods to sell to her loyal customers.

Analin's mission is to achieve financial independence and security for herself now and in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a photographer, and she studied this business for four years before setting up her own photo studio. Elizabeth covers occasions like wedding ceremonies, etc. Oftentimes she has had more than one customer at a time and because of that, she finds it difficult meeting their demands because she has one camera only. She loses them to other competitors. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase printing chemicals and a digital camera so as to meet the demands of her customers. She already has a trained shop assistant who will use a second camera to cover ceremonies. Elizabeth is 50 years old, married and has five children who are in all in school. Elizabeth says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for printing and a digital camera

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is the mother of two children, and she was born in 1970. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Gubadli region, and is now settled in Baku city.

Eight years ago she started her business of running a small general store. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale at a small general store.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah S., age 37, is a widow. She lives with her two young children in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries, vegetable, typically earning US $6 per day. She is also involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer when she is free from her business. S. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for her family and her two children. Therefore, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase more groceries and vegetable to expand her current business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 45 years old and has six children. She earns a living by selling rechargeable phone cards, and has applied for this loan to buy more cards to sell. She extends heartfelt thanks to all Kiva lenders for making it possible for her to do this.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta Lidia V. O. reside en  Sta. María en el  departamento de Usulután. Marta tiene 42 años de edad vive solamente con sus cuatro hijas. Marta trabaja hace seis años en el negocio que inicio en su casa y ahora a transportado hasta el mercado regional de Usulután, ahora que Marta ha montado su  tortillería en el mercado, sus ingresos han ido mejorando notablemente, pero hoy se encuentra con el inconveniente de tener poca cantidad de insumos para sacar mas producción, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para comprar  mayor cantidad de materia prima y así lograr aumentar su producción al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta Lidia V. O. lives in Santa María in the department of Usulután. She is 42 years old and lives with her four daughters. For six years, she has been working at the business she started at home and later moved to the regional market of Usulután. Now that she has her tortilla establishment in the market, her earnings have improved dramatically.

Marta now faces the problem of having few supplies on hand to keep up with production. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her production and reap the resulting profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Jony Alexis

texts.es: El señor Jony Alexis, el tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El señor tiene un negocio de videojuegos, el cual funciona como una fuente alterna de ingresos para su familia, ya que el labora en la alcaldía. Este negocio empezó hace 3 años con muy poco capital de trabajo con tres maquinas de video juegos, ahora el ya tiene 5 maquinas y desea comprar una más que esta actualizada para que sea más atractivo el acercarse a su negocio. Hace 7 meses tuvo problemas de electricidad, pese a ello se le fundieron 2 maquinas sin embargo es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para  la compra de nuevas maquinas y la reparación de las que se dañaron. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio para tener una mayor estabilidad económica de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jony Alexis, 23, is single and does not have any children. He has a video game business, which serves as an alternate source of income for his family. He works in the mayor’s office. He started his business three years ago with a little bit of money from work. He started with three video game machines, and now he has five. He wants to buy one more that is updated. This is so that it will be more attractive to approach his business. Seven months ago he had problems with electricity. Because of this, two machines burned out. That is why he is asking for the loan to buy new machines and repair the ones that were damaged. His goal is to expand the business more in order to have greater economic stability for him and his family

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Olegaria

texts.en:
Olegaria C. is from the village of Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old and married with 6 adult children. To make a living, she raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting "mais" (corn) for sale. Olegaria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Olegaria joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olegaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Olegaria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP; she will use the money to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Olegaria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: used to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food for her current breeding. Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy six more pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypich T., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sokhai Khoem, 24, were married in 2008 and have just had a young daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreypich has been a farmer since she was young, while her husband has been a policeman for five years. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase seeds, pesticide, and fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides & fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Evejella

texts.en:
Evejella Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Evejella is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evejella owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Evejella has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evejella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evejella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evejella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino es un hombre trabajador de 47 años, vive junto a su esposa Dominga, de 38 años, y sus dos hijos: Noemí de 17 y Raquel de 15 años, en su casa propia.
Está muy orgulloso de ser agricultor desde hace 20 años, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la que le da ideas para progresar. Con esfuerzo y dedicación en lo que mejor sabe hacer desea brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, ya que con las ganancias que obtuvo de la agricultura pudo comprar su casa y amoblarla, también pudo comprar terrenos fértiles donde cosecha gran cantidad de papa, arveja, maíz y flores (gladiolos).
Para más adelante, planea comprar terrenos productivos en una zona cafetalera de la selva central del Perú.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como la primera vez, demostrará que es responsable en sus acciones. Asimismo asegura que está contento de pertenecer a un banco comunal muy organizado. Con el monto que ahora solicita comprará tres sacos de fertilizantes y dos botellas de insecticida para proteger sus sembríos, y también pretende cubrir el pago de los operarios que contratará.
texts.en:
Celestino is a hard-working, 47 year old man. He lives with his wife, 38 year old Dominga, and his two children, 17 year old Noemí and 15 year old Raquel. They live in their own house. He is very proud to have been a farmer for 20 years. He has his wife’s support; she gave him the ideas to progress. With effort and dedication in what he knows how to do best, he wants to give his family a good quality of life. With the income from the farming he was able to buy a house and furnish it. He was also able to buy fertile land where he harvests a great quantity of potatoes, peas, corn, and flowers (gladiolas). Later on he plans to buy fertile land in a coffee growing area in the central jungle of Perú. This is the second loan he has had with MFP. Like the first time, he will show that he is responsible in his actions. He affirms that he is happy to belong to such an organized communal bank. With the amount that he is now requesting he will buy three sacks of fertilizer and two bottles of insecticide to protect the plants in his fields. He also intends to pay the workmen he will hire.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Kiyunga Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Alice (shown inset top left as well as in the main photograph) is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a determined lady who is married with two children, aged three and five, both of whom are in nursery as she takes care of her parents. 
Alice is a businesswoman involved in the sale of agricultural produce, fruits and vegetables, from Katoogo trading center. She says that her previous loan, which was her first ever, helped her to increase her stock and the quality of what she sells. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler supplying to other traders in the market and in other markets. Alice is requesting a loan to stock more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
Este será su tercer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido por su cooperación ya que le han ayudad a mejorar su taller y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar una maquinaria que le está haciendo falta. 
 Pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ganancias del taller, ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus dos hijos adolescentes y desea que tenga un buen estudio.
texts.en:
This will be his third loan with Kiva and he is very thankful for their cooperation since they have helped him to improve his shop and give better service to his customers. He is requesting another loan to be able to buy machinery that he is lacking. He will pay the loan with a part of his shop's earnings since he has under his responsibility his two adolescent children and he wishes that they get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine and a manometer.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balvina es casada tiene 5 hijos.  Doña Balvina es comerciante desde hace 15 años tiene una venta en el mercado municipal de Antigua Guatemala los dias martes y jueves, y durante los dias viernes y domingos vende en el mercado municipal de San Martin Jilotepeque; en los dos puestos vende artículos de consumo diarío y en su tiempo libre teje güipiles, Doña Balvina solicita el crédito para invertir en la venta de artículos de consumo diario que tiene, comprar material para la elaboración de güipiles y gallinas.
texts.en:
Balvina is married and has five children. She has been a merchant for the past 15 years with a sales post at the municipal market of Antigua Guatemala from Monday through Thursday, and on Fridays and Sundays she sells at the municipal market of San Martin Jilotepeque. She sells grocery items at her posts, and in her free time she weaves traditional garments. Balvina is requesting the loan to invest in her business and also purchase chickens and weaving materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her sales posts and also purchase chickens and weaving materials.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga E. is a 39-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Ulaanbaatar.  She is married and does not have any children.  To make a living, Uyanga owns and operates a jewelry business.  Uyanga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,150,000 Tugrug a month.

Uyanga joined Credit Mongol LLC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 Tugrug.  This loan, her first from Credit Mongol LLC, will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Uyanga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her jewelry business.

About Credit Mongol:
Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro and SME clients and to become the best performing company in micro and SME financing in Mongolia.

loans.use: To expand her jewelry business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene un consultorio donde brinda servicios de enfermería, tales como toma de presión arterial, curaciones, test de embarazos, inyecciones, etc.; tiene un año aproximadamente en esta actividad ya que el año pasado terminó su carrera de enfermería, anteriormente tenía una fotocopiadora, pero su sueño siempre fue tener su propio consultorio. Tiene un hijo que está en edad escolar, ella sola se dedica a su manutención, vive en la zona de Pampahasi, y es muy conocida por la zona. el crédito será invertido en completar el saldo que le falta para tomar el local en anticrético, ya que le está yendo bien, es una persona responsable y trabajadora con ganas de superacion desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina operates a clinic where she offers her services as a nurse, which include blood pressure checks, first aid, pregnancy tests, injections, etc. She started this business a year ago shortly after finishing her nursing degree. Cristina previously managed a photocopy shop, but her dream had always been to establish her own clinic. She has a son who is of school age and is dedicated to supporting him. Cristina lives in the Pamphasi district and is well-known in the area.

Her loan will be used to cover the remaining balance that is required to enter into an “anticrético” lease agreement so that she can secure the location for her clinic. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) Cristina’s business is doing well. She is a responsible and hardworking person who desires to improve herself and provide a better quality of life for her entire family.

Cristina is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in an “anticrético” lease agreement to secure the location for her clinic

loans.name: Isaiah Otieno

texts.en:
Isaiah Otieno O. has a chain of motorcycles that operate as taxis in Migori. He started this business in 2009, after quitting selling clothes, to generate enough income to be able to support his family. He is 40 years old, married, and is the father of five children.

Isaiah would like to add another motorcycle that will ensure an increased income as he works towards achieving his dream of owning a vehicle for a matatu (minibus) business. But to achieve this, he needs a loan of Ksh 50,000.

loans.use: To add another motorcycle to his business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea V. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she operates a small business raising a few pigs for income. Beyond this, she has a life partner in her husband, who is hired by people to plow farmland for a fee. She was married many years, but has no children yet. Chea V. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time in order to earn money to ensure that the family has a better life. Chea V. is taking out her first loan to support her pig raising activity.

loans.use: To support her pig raising activity.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito de Tambogrande de la provincia de Piura, sus actividades económicas principales son la agricultura y la ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas de camino de la ciudad de  Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabaja como ganadero desde hace siete años, el cría vacas en un corral cercano a su vivienda y diariamente extrae la leche que estas producen y la ofrece en venta en la ciudad de Sullana. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre trata de darle a sus animales un buen cuidado y alimentación para que estos tengan una buena producción.

Roger desea mejorar la producción de su ganado brindándole una mejor alimentación, por ello desea adquirir alimento balanceado y pastos naturales con los cuales sus vacas producirán mas leche y aumentara sus ventas y ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Roger es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de evida. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Roger is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the community of Valle San Juan of the district of Tambogrande of the province of Piura. Its main economic activities are agriculture and cattle. It is located in the Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region. He has worked with cattle for more than seven years. He raises cows in a corral close to his residence and every day extracts the milk that they produce and offers it for sale in the city of Sullana. This business is the main source of income so he always tries to give good care and feed to his animals so they will always have good production. Roger wants to improve his cattle's production by offering them better feed. That is why he wants to acquire balanced feed and natural grasses with which his cows will produce more milk and his sales and earnings will increase. To acheive this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Roger is a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to offer his mother a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, he is very well known and esteemed by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and natural grasses to improve the feed and production of his dairy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase high-quality cosmetics and furniture for her salon

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en:
Freeman B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Help. He is 56 years old, is married, and has seven children who range in age from 21 to 33. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For 22 years, he has been selling charcoal in Nezoe Community Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as a loving person.

His goal is to improve his business and build a warehouse.

In the photo, Martha is inset at the lower right because she was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Elmer de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Emerson de 9 y Medali de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La bodega de Haydee es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lleva 9 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old. She is a sincere and cheerful woman and she lives in her own home with her husband Elmer, 40, and their two beloved children, Emerson, 9 and Medali, 2. They are the reason for all of their hard work. Haydee's convenience store is the first one to open in her town. Her doors are open at 6 am ready to welcome her early rising customers. They know the variety of her store's merchandise and they trust her because they know taht they are going to find what they need. She has been in this business for 9 years and what she likes the most about the work is talking to her customers. In time, she hopes to grow her business and offer her customers a better service. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make the payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other group members. She s very respected in the group and she is very respected there and brings order to the group. With the three thousand soles that she is asking for, she will buy more products to outfit her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to outfit her store.

loans.name: G. S. La Nueva Vida En Cristo Group

texts.es: La señora María R. Hernández tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con tres, hijos los cuales ya dos son mayores de edad y una hija de 13 años. La señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado el mayoreo. Este negocio surgió desde hace 9 años, dio inicio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja el país, además de la necesidad de un ingreso fijo. Este negocio lo aprendió de su mama. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de poder invertir en el negocio y de esta manera poder salir adelante. Otro integrante de este grupo es don José Santiago el cual tiene 51 años de edad, Su esposa es ama de casa y solamente le ayuda a preparar la mercadería. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, el tiene un pequeño tramo localizado en el mercado. El último integrante del grupo es don José Luis, es casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica al comercio de frutas, por lo que le ayuda en su negocio. El señor se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, el cual vende en el mercado. Este negocio ya tiene 5 años de estar funcionando, dio inicio ante la necesidad de mantener a su hija, después vio que era rentable y decidieron establecerse en un local. Por lo que juntos han decido mejorar sus negocios por medio de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Ms. María R. Hernández is a 48-year-old married mother with three children, two of whom are grown, and one daughter is 13. Ms. R. sells fruits and vegetables at the wholesale market for a living. She started this business 9 years ago because of the high unemployment rate in the country at that time. Furthermore, she needed to have a steady income. She learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing it in her business so that she can get ahead. Another member of the group is Mr. José Santiago, age 51, whose wife is a homemaker and helps him prepare the merchandise. He also sells fruits and vegetables at his small stand in the market. The last group member is Mr. José Luis, who is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. His wife sells fruits, and he helps her out. He sells fruits and vegetables at the market.
